loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers was established by three people who live in Prek Tmey Commune in Kandal Province. Its leader, Mrs. Y., was born 1955. She is earning money by selling flowers for beer gardens and other ceremonies. She grows the flowers from her home and sometimes buys them from a market seller.

She is married with two children, one of whom is married and the other one is single and employed. Her husband is a local construction worker. Y. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. In order to expand the business, Y. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to use for growing flowers, and to buy some flowers from the market to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

M., who is a flower seller, and she requests a loan to purchase more flowers for sale.

S., who sells a few groceries from home. She is applying for a loan to buy more grocery inventory for sale.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to use for growing flowers

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang C. Eng is 37 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Since 1999, she and her husband have worked as recyclers, together making $4 every day. This couple has two children, both  students. (Mrs. Heang is pictured here with her husband). They will use their loan to purchase recyclables from locals to sell to the wholesale recycler.

loans.use: recyclable materials

loans.name: Razia Begum Riaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Razia begum baji is a widow and a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband left her with no financial resources. Razia baji bears the hardships all alone. She started sewing clothes day and night to survive with her three children: two daughters and one son. She didn’t remarry because she focused only on her children and their future. She used her income to pay off their school fees. Now Razia baji’s eyesight doesn’t allow her to sew clothes. So she started selling fertilizer because in Vehari people mostly work in agriculture. So she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for selling.  

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shahadat baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken meat selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Yoromia

texts.en:
Yoromia J. is 40 years old and married, with six children who go to school. Her husband is a driver. Yoromia sells tomatoes and would like a loan to open up a shop. With the extra profits that result from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Tochiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо 44 лет. Она вдова. Её муж умер 5 лет назад. Она осталась с 4-мя детьми. От мужа ей осталось небольшое стадо овец. Сейчас стадо пасет ее старший сын. Сыну 25 лет. Он еще не женат. Для женитьбы ему надо много денег, но пока их деньги хватает только на жизнь. Сын хотел уехать в Россию, но Точинисо отговорила его, и сказала, чтобы он хорошо работал этим летом, занимаясь купле – продажей скота, и осенью они сыграют свадьбу. Точинисо решила помочь своему сыну с помощью кредита. За счет кредита она купит ему еще несколько овец.
texts.en:
Tochiniso is 44 years old. She is a widow. Her husband passed away fives years ago and she is left with four children. Her husband left her a small amount of sheep. Today her son shepherds the herd. Her son is 25 years old and not married yet. He needs a lot of money to get married, but at this time the money is only enough for their life. He wanted to go to Russia, but Tochiniso has convinced him not too and told him that he needs to work hard this summer by buying and selling cattle, and in the fall he can have a wedding. Tochiniso decided to help her son by taking out a loan. This loan will let him buy a few more sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya B. is 26 years old and lives with her mother and five siblings in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She, her mother and one of her brothers are the only income earners in the family. As the oldest sibling in the family, she runs a small business in order to pay the everyday expenses of her big family. Since 2000, she has been selling women's and men's clothing at the local clothing apparel market. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, and purchases cheap yet trendy clothes for young women and men. Being 26 years old, she is good at picking desirable clothes for the younger people in the town. She hopes to make sure that all her siblings will be able receive a good education and pursue their dreams. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's clothes for her business

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Mrs. Carlita A. lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old and has been a member of PMPC-Microfinance for two years. She has only one child, who lives with them and studies at the elementary level. She has a happy family with her husband and child. The loan she seeks now is for her ninth cycle in the amount of PHP 12,500.00 to buy food for the fish in her fish pond. Her future plan for her business is to have a good harvest. She is thankful that her life now is quite good.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish pond

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seeds and other farm related items.

loans.name: Cherlylyn

texts.en: Cherlylyn M. is applying for a loan of 12,000 PHP as additional working capital for a sari-sari store to buy more stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. She is 34 years old, married with two children and lives in Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of Paglaum last January 2008. She is managing her business successfully. In fact, it covers their daily needs and she is able to save money for the education of their children.

loans.use: To restock a sari-sari store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira S. is from the town of Langcangan, in Mahinog Camiguin. She is 43 years old. Elvira is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste and other items in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional opersonal products and expand product offering

loans.name: Kwami

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de cartes de recharges  téléphoniques, il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante ce qui lui permet de toucher plus de clients et de vendre plus. Sa clientèle a grandit, pour les satisfaire convenablement il veut rehausser son stock avec 3 cartons de cartes de recharges TOGOCEL, 3 cartons de cartes MOOV et 2 cartons de cartes ILLICO
texts.en:
This gentleman sells phone cards. He sells them door-to-door which allows him to contact lots of customers and to make more sales. His clientele has grown and to satisfy them appropriately, he wants to add to his inventory by buying 3 cartons of TOGOCEL rechargeable phone cards, 3 cartons of MOOV cards, and 2 cartons of ILLICO cards.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Culture de la patate douce

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 34 years old and is residing with her family in the village of Malamag West Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Joey who is 32 years old. They own a farm and her husband is the one working on it. They have three kids and all of them are currently studying in the primary school. According to Marites, she will do her best to grow her business to able provide sufficient needs to her children especially when it comes to their education.

Marites has been three years managing her own variety store in their village. She always aspires to be more competent by having more grocery items to retail in her small store. She is hoping to avail a loan of PHP3, 000 to have additional working capital to further improve her business. She hopes that her loan will be approved because it will help her business grow further and for the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Nekaruut B Group

texts.en:
Nekaruut B is a group of eight people from Merbaun Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Merbaun Village is situated about 42 km from Kupang City, the capital city of East Nusa Tenggara Province. The last 6 km of road used to enter Merbaun Village is in a really bad condition. This is why it takes about two hours to drive from Kupang City to Merbaun.

There are many coconut, banana and betel nut trees growing in Merbaun Village. The local community relies on the agricultural sector to support their families. The challenge for the Merbaun community is the availability of public transport in the village. Such transport is only available twice a week, limiting the opportunities farmers have for going to market to sell their products. Generally, the houses in this area are constructed simply and have no electricity supply. Even though electricity is available in this area, the community cannot afford it as the installation cost is quite expensive.

Nekaruut B group is led by a 33-year-old farmer, Ferdinan P.. He is married and blessed with two children: Marthen P., 9, in the third grade of elementary school, and Iwan P., 7, in the first grade of elementary school. Like many other farmers, Ferdinan relies on farming to generate money to meet his family's needs. He usually sells coconuts and bananas from his own farm at the market. Sometimes the coconuts and bananas that Ferdinan brings to the market do not all sell, and he has to bring them back to the village and sell them at a cheaper price. This is the only way for him to make money as he doesn’t have any other business. For two years Ferdinan fattened cattle owned by an entrepreneur from Kupang, but he felt that the fee was insufficient to meet his family's needs. He really wants to better provide for his family but his lack of capital is the main issue.

The situation that Ferdinan faces motivated him to join the TLM cattle-fattening program. The hope for a better future and his experience in fattening cattle has given him the self-confidence to join the program. Ferdinan is requesting a loan of 3,400,000 IDR from Kiva partner TLM to buy young cattle to fatten in 12 months. He hopes that this loan will help him better meet his family's needs. The other group members are also requesting loans to buy young cattle. They hope their loans lead them to a better life.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Mrs. Rim Meak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who are all living in Rim M. village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Rim M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Rim M. and her husband, Mr. U. Voeun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Now, Mrs. Rim M. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to use to plow the rice field.

Mrs. Rim M. is 44 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a construction worker, another is a laborer, three are attending the local school, and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and for plowing her rice field

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth sells sarongs in the market. She is married with 4 children and she is 39 years old.

Ruth hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase a variety of clothing items to significantly expand her clothing trade. Ruth believes that having an assortment of women's outerwear that is both practical and good quality will increase her sales and offer both warmth and style suitable to any taste and weather.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ANGELICA es una madre D. familia, tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, tienen dos hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS” D. la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio D. distribución D. mixtura (son elementos D. papel D. forma circulas y largas que es utilizado en las fiestas). Ella distribuye a todos las tiendas minoristas la ciudad del Cusco. Ella trae el producto D. la ciudad D. Juliaca del departamento D. Puno. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más serpentinas D. papel. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Angelica is 50 years old. She is married, with two children. They live in the city of Cusco. She is a member of the “Manos Juntas” [Hands Together] communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

Angelica balances her household duties with a business distributing “mixtura,” confetti in round and long shapes that is used in celebrations. She distributes to all the small stores in Cusco, as well as the city of Juliaca, in the department of Puno. She has operated this business for several years and it has gone very well, thanks to the determination she puts into her work.

Angelica is a hardworking and enterprising mother who wants her family to get ahead. She requires a loan to increase her working capital and buy more confetti. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working captial and buy confetti

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 28 años, vive al lado de su pequeño e inquieto hijo Nicolás, de 4 años; también vive con una tía que le ayuda en la crianza de su hijo cuando ella debe salir a trabajar. Juntos habitan en la tranquilidad de su casa propia, ubicada en la zona sierra del Perú.

La vida de esta trabajadora mujer no ha sido fácil, ya que sola ha debido de sacar adelante a su hijo. Cada día se despierta con muchos ánimos de trabajar, ella es secretaria en un despacho parroquial de una iglesia cercana a su casa, pero además elabora manualidades usadas para la educación inicial, los cuales que vende a muy buen precio en su bazar-librería.
De muy joven aprendió a realizar los más peculiares materiales didácticos a base de corrospun, ya que tiene habilidad en las manos para dar forma a diversos dibujos y plasmarlos creativamente sobre un material resistente. Es así que cuando se vio sola empezó a poner en práctica lo que había aprendido, esto la ayudó a salir adelante.
Pero Ana no sólo tiene su librería, sino que también prepara y vende anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res y papas a la parrilla).
Como Ana es una mujer emprendedora ya tiene pensado ampliar su librería-bazar y seguir progresando como lo ha venido haciendo, porque sabe que así puede llegar a darle una profesión a su pequeño hijo.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser puntual y responsable en cada pago, ya que quiere seguir siendo parte de su banco comunal, conformado por personas trabajadoras como ella. El dinero que solicita lo tiene pensado invertir en la compra de materiales para seguir creando sus manualidades; también abastecerá su librería con más artículos para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old; she lives with her tireless little 4-year-old, Nicolás, and with an aunt who helps her with the child when she has to work out of the home. They all live in Ana's own home in the sierra area of Peru. Life for Ana has not been easy - she's a single mother - but every day she wakes up eager to go to work. She is a secretary at her church's office, which is near her house. She also makes crafts that are used in early education and which she sells successfully at her bookstore/general goods store. She learned to make didactic materials out of craft foam at a young age; she has the ability to make all sorts of drawings and to give them creative form on a strong material. When she found herself alone, she started putting into practice the craft she herself had learned and this has pushed her to prosper. Ana not only owns her own bookstore, but also prepares and sells "anticuchos" (cow heart kabobs and barbecued potatoes). Ana is such an entrepreneurial woman, that she is planning on expanding her bookstore/general goods store and on continuing to prosper in order to give her little son an opportunity to become a professional. This is the second loan Ana is requesting from Kiva partner MFP and she is confident she will be timely and responsible with her payments because she wants to continue being a part of her community bank, whose members are hardworking people like her. With the money from the loan, Ana will buy materials to continue creating crafts. She will also stock her bookstore to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying craft supplies

loans.name: Faatatau

texts.en:
Faatatau V. is 45 and married with 6 children (ages 9 - 18 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faatatau has many years of experience in this business.  Faatatau needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 110 tala or US $46 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faatatau joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faatatau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faatatau V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at: http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is a woman of courage to battle challenges in order to achieve her goals in life. She is 46 years old and married to Virgilio, 46, who is a fisherman. She is a caring mother of two children who are both of minor age. She lives in the coastal place of Talim Island, town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of having start-up funds for generating income. Since she received loans from ASHI, she carefully invested it in her fishing business and it gave her reasonable earnings. 

Now on her fourth loan, she requests 20,000 Philippine pesos for additional working capital for her fishing business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase a fishnet, rope, bamboo, fingerlings (young or very small fish) and labor expenses. She also plans to buy one motorboat to consistently visit their fish pond.

As a mother, Arlene dreams of sending her two children to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for healthier lives. She also enjoys considering that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and provide her family's needs. She also dreams of building a big house for her family to live in.

loans.use: Purchase fishnet, rope, bamboo, fingerlings and pay for labor expenses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old woman; she is married to E. and they have two children. Her husband is a civil servant and they live in Sapele, Delta State. Mary sells baby items, clothes and sarongs to make a living. She has been in this business for 15 years. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more baby things, clothes and sarongs to sell. Mary is a LAPO client. She is itching for a significant expansion in her business. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items, clothes and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a hair stylist and she makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers in Ughelli. She also sells hair extensions and cream. Her customers are usually friends and residents. She hopes to own a classic hair salon in the future.

Rachael hopes for a loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell.  She is married with 2 children and her husband is a carpenter and he also supports their home. Her children attend a private school. She is 29 years old. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the famous Angkor Wat Temple. She is employed as a chef for an income of about USD 4 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. With the remainder, she wants to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to pay for the children’s schooling. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. (S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparing polenta balls made of cornmeal (for sale)

loans.name: Fasilatu

texts.en: Fasilatu sells groceries and sarongs at retail prices. With these businesses, she supports her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. She is 45 years old and married, with 3 children. Her husband is a bricklayer and he also supports their family. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more groceries and sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El sr Juan C. está casado con la Sra. Ilsa Sanguina de C. tienen dos hijos y viven en la Atyra, el Sr. Juan posee una parada de  moto taxi  en el cruce Tobati.
Su actividad consiste en ayudar a gente que desciende del bus llevando sus bolsas o acercar a la gente hasta su casa.
Este trabajo resulta bastante bien y quiere invertir en la compra de otra moto taxi y trabajar con un socio, para concretar este proyecto solicita el préstamo.
El sr Juan empezó con una unidad su trabajo y desea seguir creciendo para obtener más ingreso y así dar una vida digna a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan C. is married to Mrs. Ilsa Sanguina de C., they have two children and live in Atyra. Juan owns a motorcycle taxi stand at the Tobati crossroads. His work consists of helping people who get off the bus with their bags, or taking people to their houses. This business has worked well, and he wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and work with a partner, which is why he is requesting this loan. Juan started with only one motorcycle, and he wants to keep growing in order to make more income and give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es: Héctor V. S., tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales y productos para la mejoras en el área de repastos. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento  a la cercas y en poder mantener  calidad en los repastos, para que el ganado que tiene se desarrolle de la mejor manera y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área que desea mejorar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Héctor tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Héctor V. S. is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is requesting this loan to buy materials and products to make improvements to his pastures. He wants to perform proper maintenance on the fences and to be able to maintain high-quality pastures, so that his cattle will develop as well as possible and therefore fetch the best price possible when he sells them. He also hopes to increase his number of animals and to be able to keep them under better conditions, and he has a specific area he would like to improve. This is the first time he is receiving a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services they have offered him. Mr. Héctor has been raising cattle for several years. In the future, he hopes to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He would also like to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements to cattle pastures

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila G., 49, is from the village of Larayan, Dapitan City. She is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Lila owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Lila has been  in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Lila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Lila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase products to sell.  Lila is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products to sell and for medication of her husband.  This loan will be her 9th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

--------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell and medication of her husband.

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Ayudador Group

texts.en:
Altane is the coordinator of her group, Dios es nuestro ayudador 3, which means "God our helper." Her group consists of 5 Haitian women. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Altane is excited to be seeking her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. More specifically, she will use the proceeds to sell clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She will in turn save any profits and strive to continually improve her business with additional loans and savings.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based around tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing clothes, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: María Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo María Isabel está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una ellas es la señora Irenia del Carmen L. quienes venden frutas y verduras desde la edad de 15 años. L. tiene cinco hijos de los cuales los dos menores de 18 y 16 años dependen de ella.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Thelma R. Jiménez quien vende pan desde hace 10 años y Jessenia Marcías Gonzales quien vende fajas y CD desde el 2006.
texts.en:
The María Isabel group is made up of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women. One of them is Mrs. Irenia del Carmen L. who has sold fruits and vegetables since she was 15 years old. She has five children. The two youngest, who are 18 and 16 years of age, are still dependent on her. The other group members are: Thelma R. Jiménez who has sold bread for the last 10 years and Jessenia Marcías Gonzáles who has sold sashes and CDs since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal crops.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita P. is from the village of Bantay, Solana, Cagayan. She is 53 years old. Jovita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn Sta. M., 46 years of age, is married to a farmer, Vicente Sta. M.. They were blessed with two sons and one daughter. Emelyn joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), Rizal Central Branch, a partner Microfinance Institution of KIVA, in the year 1998. She decided to S. with the lending institution because she had found fulfillment being a member. She is proud because ASHI is part of the achievements of her eldest son and daughter who are now degree holders. Their eldest works now as a seaman, and her daughter just graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics. Her youngest son is still in college. Their primary source of income is farming and secondary is the tricycle which her husband drive for passenger purposes. 

Again she is applying for a loan to buy cattle for her husband to use in tilling their farm land. With the help of these cattle, expenses on rentals for tractors/machinery to plow their land will be reduced. The couple projects to increase their profit and wants to develop their farming method. Their future plan is to increase rice production and buy additional livestock, not just for the future of their family, but they want to provide employment to their community too and help other families as well. They are hoping that ASHI and KIVA will continue their partnership in helping them meet their goals in life and also providing capital and encouraging poor but enterprising families to rise from poverty.

loans.use: Cattles to use in cultivating their farmland

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad.

La socia Marleni; La socia tiene 37 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, La socia es la representante nacional D. pueblos andinos, ella conocedora del buen arte y ser ganadora D. muchos premios por su fino trabajo en textileria, a sido fotografiada y documnetada en diversos documentales y filmes internacionales, llevando el proceso D. su arte a la pantalla, para ellos no es algo normal verse en la televisión, y es que este pequeño y pintoresco pueblo Chinchero, es mágico y atrae miles D. turistas a sus placitas y callejuelas caprichosas, el aire puro las sonrisas cálidas D. los lugareños, son sin duda lo mejor que tiene Chinchero, entonces es por estas razones que innumerables veces se ha visto a gente muy importante paseando en ellas, La socia es muy modesta y sin ningún lujo, ella sonríe feliz a la vida, deseando lo mejor para su pueblo, ella sigue siendo una D. las destacadas artesanas, ella continua estudiando ingles y junto a esto desea comprar materiales e invertir en el taller al que representan en su comunidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar, detergentes naturales, tintes, lanas y otros materiales y sus clases D. ingles.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Marleni, 37, is married and has 4 children. She is a National Representative of Andean Peoples. She is knowledgeable of fine art and has won many awards for her textiles. She has been photographed and documented in various documentaries and international films taking her art processes to the big screen. For them it is not at all usual to see themselves on television. But this small and picturesque town of Chinchero is magic and attracts thousands of tourists to its small squares and whimsical lanes. The pure air and warm smiles of the locals are, without a doubt, the best that Chinchero has. For these reasons very important personages have often been seen strolling through town. Marleni is very modest with no luxuries. She smiles happily at life wishing the best for her town. She continues to be one of its most outstanding artisans. She continues taking English classes and also wants to buy supplies and invest in the workshop that represents her community. She is asking for funds to buy natural detergents, dyes, wools and other materials and for her English classes. She is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA-CHINCHERO” communal bank which is located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department, 45 minutes from the city. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratituD. for the loan as well as to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural detergents, dyes, wools and other materials and for her English classes.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo de 47 años de edad es soltero, tiene 2 hijs, el mayor de 8 y el menor de 5 añitos, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Trabaja como vendedor de productos perecederos (verduras y frutas)  y abarrotes desde hace 14 años en la zona del Ayote, a donde viaja semanalmente.  

Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio, comprando mayor variedad de producto para tratar de abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, y lograr mayores ventas que le proporcionaran mejores ganancias que le permitiran brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de bien que puedan sacar adelante nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 47 years old. He is single and has two children, 8 and 5, who are elementary school students. Ricardo has worked selling perishable goods (vegetables and fruits) and groceries for 14 years in the Ayote area, where he travels weekly.

He is requesting his sixth loan for the purpose of strengthening his businesses. He will purchase a greater variety of goods to meet the demand of his customers and to have better sales. This will provide him with greater earnings that will allow him to provide his family with better living conditions.

His biggest dream is for his children to study and be good men that can get our country ahead.

loans.use: Groceries and vegetables

loans.name: 10.15.01 Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Linh V. T. (45) is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Linh is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01 Đông Sơn (10. 15. 01 Đông Sơn). 

Linh is married and has two school-aged children. Linh owns & operates a business providing general services to local community members. Linh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Linh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Linh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. The loan will be the her fourth from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Linh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. T. T. Ngoc (47) is a 61 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products. 

2. H. T. Dinh (49) is a 62 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 

3. N. T. Tu (12) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her retail store. 

4. B. T. Kim Thanh (268) is a 43 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food. 

5. N. T. Van Anh (82) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 

6. L. M. Huong (48) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her clothing business. 

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. 


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 


Linh V. T. (45) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Linh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có seven các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01 Đông Sơn (10. 15. 01 Đông Sơn). 


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Linh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn five năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Linh kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2008, Linh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Linh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3, 079, 800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6, 000, 000 VND. 


Khoản vay sẽ là fourth khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. T. T. Ngoc (47) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 


2. H. T. Dinh (49) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 


3. N. T. Tu (12) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 


4. B. T. Kim Thanh (268) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 


5. N. T. Van Anh (82) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 


6. L. M. Huong (48) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. 


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. "

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her maid).

Dorcus has a business of making samosas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 1 day out of every week. Dorcus sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Dorcus has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cow peas and wheat flour. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

The main business challenge(s) for Dorcus include thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business of poultry farming. Dorcus lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cow peas and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ruben Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén es el esposo de una cliente antigua de la institución muy responsable y de buena actitud el señor tiene un taller de tapicería de sillas, sillones y movilidades, atiende de lunes a sábado, también realiza los trabajos en su domicilio cuando tiene pedidos en cantidad con la ayuda de su esposa y de su hermano de vez en cuando, asimismo realiza trabajos a domicilios.  Tiene dos hijos los cuales son todavía bebés su esposa se dedica a la venta varios productos en tienda de barrio, también tiene su crédito en Bancos de Emprendimiento el cual esta cancelando puntual y sin dificultades, viven en un departamento en anticrético, ambos esposos son muy jóvenes y desean superarse con el tiempo, mas adelante desean comprar una movilidad.
texts.en: Mr. Rubén is the husband of a former client of the institution. Responsible and with a positive attitude he has an upholstery shop where he upholsters chairs, armchairs, and vehicles. He works from Monday to Saturday. He also works from home when he has orders with his wife’s help and ocasionaly his brother’s.  He has two children who are still babies. His wife sells items in a neighborhood grocery store. He also has a loan in “Undertaking” Bank which he is paying back punctually and without difficulty. They live in the Anticrético Department. The couple is very young and they wish to improve their lives as time goes by. In the future they wish to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: Buy material to upholster chairs, armchairs, etc. Other: fabric, wood, and other tools.

loans.name: Saka

texts.en: Saka A. is 28 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children who both go to school. Saka is currently in the business of selling bananas, onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock more onions and tomatoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Naskul's Group

texts.en:
Naskul A. is married to a farmer. She is 39 years old. She takes care of five children; the eldest daughter is a capital university student, the rest of the children except the youngest son, who is of preschool age, are school pupils. 

This big family needs large funds. That’s why they want to increase their profits out of harvesting. Naskul wants to get a loan in order to purchase potato seeds for spring sowing.  Future plans involve increasing cattle stock, purchasing a larger home and paying for their children's education. The family is interested in achieving the best possible results.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Callanca del distrito agrícola de Monsefú, una zona situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven: Por un lado se dedica a criar y vender cerdos entre sus vecinos y los negociantes de la zona, y por el otro se dedica a la siembra de artículos de pan llevar. Ambos negocios le brindan los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

En esta oportunidad el ha sembrado arveja y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que este cultivo pueda desarrollarse con mayor facilidad. Antonio se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de alimentos para sus cerdos y abonos para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arveja.
texts.en:
Antonio is 32 years old, he is married, and he lives together with his wife and their four children in the sector of Callanca, in the agricultural district of Monsefu. It is a community located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been a farmer since he was very young. He raises and sells pigs to his neighbors and to the merchants in the region. But he also harvests grains to make breads. Each of these businesses provides him with the income that he needs to financially support his family. 

He has planted oats and he has been working arduously so that this harvest will give the best possible yield. Antonio requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. He plans to invest in the purchase of feed for his pigs and fertilizer for his oat plantation.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jakeline Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Jakeline; La socia tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera; la socia trabaja en la Instituto Nacional de Cultura, la socia paralelamente trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogos, ella vende Unique y Avon, son dos diferentes empresas de cosméticos, la socia con este paralelo oficio paga sus estudios de English, la socia requiere el préstamo para ayudarse en la mensualidad de sus clases de English, pagar sus libros y continuar estudiando. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en los pagos de sus estudios de english.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "PADRE ETERNO" (Eternal Father) communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province and department.

The member is Jakeline, who is 23 years old and single. She works in the National Institute of Culture, and also sells beauty products from a catalogue. She sells Unique and Avon products, two different cosmetic companies. This second job pays for her English studies, and she requires the loan to help her with the monthly payments for her English classes, to buy books and continue studying. The member is requesting the loan to invest in paying for her English studies.

The member is happy with the loan granted and is committed to keeping to the paying it back in installments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to invest in paying for her English studies.

loans.name: Vegie

texts.en:
Vegie A. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Vegie is married. To make a living, Vegie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food & toothpaste in the local community. Vegie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vegie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vegie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Vegie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Vegie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & canned goods

loans.name: Norwing Jose

texts.es:
El joven  Norwing Jose de 23 años de edad, Labora como docente de primaria en la comarca Casa de Tabla desde hace 8 años , todos los dias de la semana tiene que viajar a caballo para ir impartir el pan de la enseñanza, es un docente con excelente recomendaciones y bien querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, alumnos y padres de familia por ser un joven bien responsable y honesto.    

Solicita su tercer credito con el apoyo de Kiva para mejorar la infraestructura de su cocina y asi brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, ademas esta muy agradecido con este apoyo, ya que con el primer credito logró repellar las paredes de su casa; por lo que pretende continuar estas mejoras. 

Su  mayor sueño en la vida es que su preciosa familia no le falte lo basico en el hogar y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Young Norwing Jose is 23 years of age. He has worked as an elementary school teacher in the region of Casa de Tabla for eight years. Every day he must travel by horseback so that he can get to his teaching job. Norwing is a teacher with excellent recommendations and is respected by co-workers, students, and parents. He is known for being a responsible and honest young man.

Norwing is requesting his third loan with the support of Kiva so that he can improve the infrastructure of his kitchen and provide greater comfort for his family. He is very grateful for this support. His first loan was used to plaster the walls of his house, so he intends to continue making improvements.

His greatest wish in life is for his precious family to have all the basic necessities. He also wants to continue studying.

loans.use: Remodel his kitchen

loans.name: Arceli's Group

texts.en:
Arceli B. is from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Arceli is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Arceli B..

Arceli is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arceli owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Arceli has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arceli joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Arceli from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He has operated a van service for students and summer trips in his village as well as neighboring towns for over 7 years. In parallel, he has worked as a sport coach in a local school for 10 years. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to be able to handle weighty life expenses. He helps his father to satisfy the family needs.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance on his van. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and employ a part-time employee to work on it. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his van

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad de Rayo Loma en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta hermosa ciudad esta  bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico fué nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con  una variada gastronomía y su gente es amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia  tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene un hijo que ya está casado y vive  independiente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar  y aprovecha su tiempo para criar  chanchos, cuyes y gallinas a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Este es el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su meta es incrementar más animales para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa D. is member of the communal bank Vegaspamba. She lives in the Roya Loma community located in the city of Cuenca. This beautiful city is surrounded by 4 rivers, had it's historic town centre named as cultural heritage of humanity, depends on a varied cuisine, and has it's people known to be friendly and cordial.

Our member is 62 years old, married, and has a son who is married and lives independently. Her husband is a construction worker; he is a bricklayer.

Mrs. Rosa does housework and takes the opportunity to raise pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens which she sells when she needs money.

This is the eighth loan she has had with the communal bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to acquire more animals to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nely requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from trees in her surroundings.

Nely is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Soley

texts.en:
Soley is 29 years old and lives in the Congo Town area. She's single and her boyfriend works for a construction company; they have two children, a one year old and a five year old. Only the older daughter attends school. 

Soley has been selling cosmetics and footwear for the past seven years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics and a barrel of footwear for her business. She plans to be a medical doctor in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and footwear for her business

loans.name: Alcatracez Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Marcia Díaz, un miembro del grupo "ALCATRACEZ" que esta ubicado en el estado de Veracruz, Mexico. Se ve al grupo de señoras muy contentas en la foto, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado que inicio hace 11 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercancia y asi incrementar su negocio, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta y con muchos animos, ella tiene 29 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es casada y tiene 1 hija. La señora Marcia quiere este prestamo para incrementar sus ganacias, tambien espera que su negocio crezca mas para poder generar más ganancias y ser reconocida por la calidad de sus productos. Maribel D. es otra integrante del grupo, ella es la presidenta, tiene 45 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de Antojitos de comal que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el prestamo para asi incrementar su negocio y tener siempre materia prima para todos sus clientes, ya que les gusta mucho como cocina y se le acaba siempre su producto; Maribel se siente muy contenta ya que gracias a esta oportunidad va a poder brindarles educación a sus hijos y una vida de calidad. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la cuarta vez que solicitan un prestamo. oBSERVACIONES, EN LA FOTO APARECEN DOS HIJOS DE LAS SEÑORAS.
texts.en: This photo was taken in the house of Mrs. Marcia Díaz, a member of the "ALCATRACEZ" group that is located in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. You can see that the group of ladies looks very happy in the photo. She [Marcia] has sold footwear for 11 years. She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise and therefore expand her business. When asking for this loan, she is happy and in high spirits. She is 29 years old, studied through high school, is married, and has one daughter. Marcia wants this loan to increase her earnings. She also hopes that her business grows more to be able to generate more earnings and to be recognized for the quality of her products. Maribel D. is another member of the group. She is the president. She is 45 years old, studied through high school, is married, and has 2 children. She has been selling snacks that she prepares on a hot plate for four years. She is asking for the loan to expand her business and to always have raw materials for all of her customers. Since they really like how she cooks, she always runs out of her product. Maribel feels very happy since, thanks to this opportunity, she is going to be able to provide an education and a life of quality for her children. The group is made up of 9 members and this is the fourth time that they are asking for a loan. NOTE: TWO CHILDREN OF THE LADIES APPEAR IN THE PHOTO.

loans.use: to invest in footwear and raw materials to make snacks on a hotplate.

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
Ketut is a chili farmer who lives in the mountains in North Bali. Ketut has coordinated the women in her region to form a group of pig farmers. Aside from being chili farmers, she want to develop a business with raising pigs. The loan she got will be used to buy a superior pig in order to get maximum results. Currently, she is raising a local species of pigs for resale.

All revenue from the pigs will be saved for the future of her family. She has plans to renovate her house to make it better. She in the backrow number two from left, wearing white t-shirt.

loans.use: To buy a superior pig.

loans.name: Sipele

texts.en:
Sipele is 33 years of age and married with four children. Sipele owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local communities.  She has two years of experience in this business.

Sipele needs a loan of 1,450 WST to purchase more materials to make woven products, such as feathers for decoration. vanish paint and weaving equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week) to improve the business.

In 2009, Sipele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sipele's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make woven products.

loans.name: Sit

texts.en:
Mrs. Sit is a 27 years old.  Her husband is a high school teacher in his community, the Ornlong Veng district.  They have been married for a few years but do not yet have any children.  

Mrs. Sit is a good make-up artist for people who need her to make them up for their wedding day.  She also sells some cosmetic items in her house for additional income. Since 2009, she has had this business and is earning an average of $2 each day.  Recently Mrs. Sit’s business has been running better and better and she wants to buy more cosmetic products to sell.  However, she doesn’t have sufficient money to make such a purchase. This is the reason why Mrs. Sit is seeking a Kiva loan through HKL.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia de 45 años, está separada de su esposo hace ya 11 años y como madre luchadora y tenaz cuida de sus 2 hijos; Noe de 18 y Brigit de 15 años, a los que cuida y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la cuenca alta de la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Las fuerza y vitalidad de está mujer es sorprendente. Hace 2 años que sufrió la muerte de su nuera, la esposa de su hijo mayor; desde entonces lo apoya con el cuidado de Yeraldine de tan solo 3 años de edad. Sola y con muchas responsabilidades Teodosia, pudo salir adelante; cada día agradece a Dios por ello; ya que en los últimos meses adquirió una pequeño local donde pueda vender los ricos platos de comida que cocina; está actividad le resulta rentable a ella; los pobladores conocen de su exquisito sabor, pues antes vendía en una esquina de la plaza principal de su comunidad, sin un lugar acogedor para sus clientes. Asimismo siembra diversos frutos de la zona, en una huerta que tiene en su casa, que le sirven para su consuno y de vez en cuando los comercializa al menudeo. Hace poco Teodosia, tuvo una recaída en su enfermedad de cálculo en los riñones, pero eso no la desanima. Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, quiere adquirir materiales para su nuevo restaurante; sus aspiraciones son establecerse y triunfar con lo que más le gusta que es “la cocina”. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La palmeras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Teodosia, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la comprar sacos de arroz y azúcar para abastecer los insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus exquisitos platos de comida, propios de la zona.
texts.en:
45-year old Teodosia has been separated from her husband for eleven years. She works very hard to take care of her two dependent children, Noe aged 18 and Brigit aged 15. She is raising them in her own house located in Cuenca Alta in the Peruvian rainforest (in the community of Las Palmas). 

The strength and vitality of this woman are amazing. Two years ago her daughter-in-law died. Since then she has been helping her oldest son take care of 3-year old Yeraldine. Alone and with many responsibilities, Teodesia was able to move on and she is grateful to God for that.  In the last few months she has obtained a small stall where she sells the delicious food that she has cooked, and that is proving a profitable enterprise. The local people know that she is a good cook as she used to sell food in a corner of the main square, not a very comfortable place for her customers. Teodesia also grows various local fruits in a garden at her house. This produce is mostly eaten by the family but occasionally she has enough to sell. 

A short time ago she suffered another attack of kidney stones, but even that didn’t discourage her. 

Now, with help from her community bank, she wants to buy materials for a new restaurant. She wishes to make a name for herself in the work she most enjoys: cooking. Teodesia belongs to La Palmeras Community Bank. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes that with their assistance she will be able to achieve her goals. She promises to pay back the loan on schedule as she did with previous loans.

Teodesia is grateful to be part of a community bank as all the members are responsible, committed people. Once she has received the loan, she plans to buy bags of rice and sugar to use in the wonderful local dishes that she cooks.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal products to sell. Arlene has been in this business for two years. Arlene earns more income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and fruit, including coconuts.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of herbal products

loans.name: Nyakitokoli Karangura Group

texts.en:
Annet, age 26, is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in her business for the past two years. Her major challenges are unsettled debts from customers and fish going bad due to lack of refrigeration facilities.

Annet needs this loan to buy fish to offer for sale. Her dream is to expand her business.

Annet's husband is a famer, and they help each other take care of the family. They have three children and live in Fort Portal, Uganda. Their dream is to ensure the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Farahim

texts.en: Farahim is 55 and a livestock breeder with six years of experience. He is a trusted borrower of AqroInvest and KIVA. He is married and has two grown sons who are, thanks to his experience, independent adults also engaged in farming. Farahim and his sons work on the same farm and their total monthly income is about $400 USD. He usually purchases small cattle. Then he raises them and sells them in the livestock bazaar after five or six months. He would like to purchase more cattle. Summer is the high period for wedding parties and dishes from meat are very popular. Farahim would like to take this chance and purchase more cattle for their meat. This will be his fifth loan from AqroInvest and his second from KIVA.

loans.use: purchase three cattle, one pregnant cow and fodder

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер умный, добросовестный и честный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Алишер занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как картошки, морковь, лук, помидоры и кукурузы. Алишер хочет, чтобы его дети выросли в хороших условиях семьи и стали образованными, честными и культурными людьми. Алишер хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений, который позволяет ему расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыл. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Alisher is a smart, conscientious and honest person.  He is a married and loving father of three children.  Alisher is involved in growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes, carrots, onions, tomatoes and corn.  Alisher wants his children to grow up in good family conditions and become educated, honest and well-mannered people.  Alisher wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers, which will allow him to expand his business and obtain desired profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Katherine Del Milagro

texts.es:
Katherine de 23 años, vive con su esposo e hijo en la casa de su madre, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Katherine se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años para toda la familia, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Katherine es un madre muy preocupada y junto con su esposo trata que todos los días no le falte nada a su hijo.
texts.en:
23-year-old Katherine lives with her husband and son in her mother's house.  The house has water and electricity and is located in Olmos district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

Katherine has been selling clothes for all the family for four years.  She set up her business in her home and she sells merchandise to her customers.  She also provides merchandise to order.  She tries to increase her customer demand so that she can make more income with which to cover her family expenses.

As she saw that her business was improving every day, Katherine decided it was necessary to request a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she could buy a larger quantity of merchandise and stock her store with new products.  She aims to continue to increase her number of customers so that she can repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Katherine takes good care of her family and, together with her husband, she tries to ensure that her son never wants for anything.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 22 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has been operating a provision shop in her community. She likes her business because she sells quality and very expensive goods thus making more profit. She has a lot of customers. Victoria is requesting a loan to purchase tissues, soap, chloride, and cartons of cosmetics for her business. She plans to become a big businesswoman in the near future.
