loans.use: to purchase tissues, soap, chloride, and cartons of cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Hannah Jean

texts.en:
Hannah Jean is 38 years old and married with two children.

Hannah Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of goods to sell in her store.

Hannah Jean has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Hannah Jean aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 13. She runs a local food stuff store in Waterloo near Freetown. Her two children are currently attending secondary school. 

Abie has been in this business for 13 years and sells rice, local rice, dhal beans and sugar at her marketplace. Her business is her only source of income.  She says that her business is doing well. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local foodstuff. Abie says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the good health of her family and educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, dhal beans and sugar.

loans.name: Aconcagua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ACONCAGUA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yolanda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: productor lechero y agricultor. 

La señora Yolanda  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción lechera que viene trabajando desde hace 17 años atrás, el cual aprendió de su suegro.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de vaca lechera) que comprará de de su comunidad  y lo comercializa a las fabricas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The “Aconcagua” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board headed by Yolanda.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have milk production and farming.

Yolanda indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited by a promoter.  She has been a dairy farmer for the last 17 years, a line of work she learned from her father-in-law.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her merchandise.  She will buy a dairy cow in her community and will to factories.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a Kenyan married man with one child, and his wife is a farmer. He runs a general shop at civil servant Langata estate in which he sells such items as sugar, flour, beverages and detergents. He targets the residents. He has been running this business for eight years. The challenge he faces is the high cost of commodities. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase the stock of food items, beverages and detergents. His future dream is to purchase a pick-up to help in the running of his business. In the future, he also hopes to buy a plot for farming. He describes himself as very honest, and he has good customer care skills.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has three children ranging from the age of twenty-two to twenty-seven. She describes herself as an honest woman. She runs a restaurant where she sells food to new and has frequent customers. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate capital to add her stock. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy maize and wheat flour. In the future, Alice wants to run several restaurants.

loans.use: To add stock of wheat and maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es: Los integrantes del grupo siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. El señor Virgilio tiene 53 años de edad, el es soltero, no tiene hijos, el tiene una panadería, el solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, charolas, canastos, el ofrece a sus clientes pan de dulce y bolillos, el inicio su negocio hace 20 años es herencia de su papa ya no quiso seguir con el negocio y se la dejo, el tiene personal para vender el pan salen en las mañanas 5 muchachos en su triciclo a vender el pan por las calles del pueblo, su negocio es importante por las utilidades que obtiene, el está orgulloso de tener su propio negocio y seguir con la tradición de su papa, su negocio es popular por el sabor del pan de que es horneado con leña, los desafios que enfrenta su negocio son los costos en el aumento del precio de la harina y el azucar. Sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su panadería quiere compra una camioneta para salir a vender el pan a las comunidades cercanas. El está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar los materiales para surtir su panadería. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “gracias por su confianza, les agradecemos sus préstamos, por contar con estos apoyos que nos favorecen a crecer los negocio”.
texts.en:
The members of this group are still working and developing their same activities.  

Señor Virgilio is 53 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  He has a bakery.  He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, pans and baskets.  He makes sweet bread and rolls for his clients.  His father left him this business 20 years ago when he didn't want to continue in the business.  He has 5 young men that work as employees and sell the bread for him.  They leave in the mornings on tricycles and sell in the streets of their town.  His business is important because of the income it brings in.  He is proud to have his own business and continue his father's tradition.  His business is popular because of the flavor of his wood-fired bread.  The rising price of flour and sugar are a challenge for his business.  

His hopes and dreams are to expand his bakery.  He wants to buy a truck so that he can sell his bread in the nearby communities.  He is happy about the loan that he is going to receive.  He is going to buy materials to stock his bakery.  

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for your trust.  We are grateful for the loans and the support that has helped our businesses to grow."

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, pans and baskets.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is a married woman with two children. Marlita is 53 years old and resides at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Marlita owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living and she's been one year in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Marlita is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Marlita wants to build house and to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is creating problems and needs replacement. By purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to finish her orders on time and increase her income.

Razia is the mother of two children. Both of them are young and stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Razia couldn’t educate them. She is an experienced lady and has been operating her business for the past many years. She is confident that an investment will help her improve her business.

In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is from Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Hazel is married and has five children. 

To make a living, she owns and operate a business venture, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Hazel has been in her business for ten years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Hazel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel is requesting a loan of 7,050 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Mayor's Village Lapasan, Clarin Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). Margaret has a business selling cereals (ground nuts). She has been in this business for four years, and works six days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, both wholesale and retail. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of ground nuts. The main business challenges for Margaret are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for cereals and also to build her own rental houses. Margaret lives in a home that she owns, where she has access to electricity and running water. Her major monthly expenses include her utilities, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of ground nuts.

loans.name: Sharymkan

texts.ru: Шарымкан, 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 33 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Шарымкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 коров, 10 овец, лошадь. На участке, мерою 4,05 Га собственной земли, она выращивает люцерну, пшеницу и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 7,900 сом (KGS). У Шарымкан есть собственные накопленные средства, но их недостаточно, поэтому она в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шарымкан и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шарымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, так как она хочет накопить на оплату обучения ее дочери.
texts.en: Sharymkan is 52 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  Sharymkan has a secondary education.  For about 33 years now, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has seven cows, ten sheep and one horse.  She also grows alfalfa, wheat and barley on 4.05 hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of about about 7,900 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her farming business, Sharymkan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy 10 sheep for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals, because she would like to save enough to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Five years ago Rosa started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Endebess, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this mother of nine children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Endebess area. Rosa has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as KIVA, enterprising women like Rosa can achieve their dreams and goals. Rosa believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.
 Rosa just needs people to believe in her dreams and help him accomplish all her goals, and this loan will get him so much closer to that.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Dúo La Excelencia De Peronia Group

texts.es: Dúo la Excelencia de peronia Cendi Melissa de 25 años de edad, casada. Se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y café internet desde hace 2 años. Cendi Melissa tiene muchos clientes entre ellos son la mayoría jóvenes y estudiantes. Ella esta solicitando su primer crédito pues necesita invertir en productos de mayor consumo en libreria, pues se acerca la temporada escolar donde los estudiantes inician su ciclo escolar. El sueño de Cendi Melissa es tener varios locales, pues ella desea tener más clientes como también mejores ingresos.

loans.use: Comprar mercaderia de libreria para vender.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
"LAPO has brought light to my business and my family," says Mrs. Mary O.. She is 22 years old and married with 3 children. They live in Benin City located in the state of Edo in Nigeria.

She specializes in hairdressing and she is eager to use the loan to expand her hairdressing business.

loans.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena, who born in 1973, is a mother of 3 children. She is living in district 7 Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a clay pan business with 5 years experience. She makes these items in her house. After completing the process her husband sells in the bazaar especially to the tourists and foreigners buying these materials. In the summer, she makes lots of clay pots with new designs and good quality and then she sells them where people come for holiday and sightseeing. To support her family financially, she prefers this business, so therefore she took a loan to buy more materials for her shop.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a married mom with two children. She sells quality footwear in the local market, and is the chief breadwinner in her family. Yelena has been in this business for eight years. Her daily net profit is about $10 - $40. 

Yelena is customer-friendly, cheerful, optimistic, and is very persistent in her work. She works in her kiosk every day, even when the weather conditions are not very favorable. Yelena sets a good example for her friends who are also working as market vendors. Eleven loans received from “Nadiya Ukraine”, cheap rental fees for her kiosk, and the convenient location of her vending facility have added greatly to her entrepreneurial success. 

This winter season was tough on Yelena’s trade – her sales were really low. She will use this loan of $1,200 to increase her seasonal inventory, boost her sales and generate additional profits over the summer. Yelena is planning to re-stock some of the shoe items in her kiosk and add new, trendy and stylish footwear to her inventory. She has been dreaming about remodeling her apartment for a long time, and is hoping to use some of the extra income produced by this loan to make her dream come true.

loans.use: Increase summer inventory

loans.name: Henriqueta Sebastião

texts.pt:
Henriqueta Sebastião M. tem 42 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 3 filhos. Reside no bairro Albasine arredores da cidade de Maputo.Tem um pequeno aviário em casa no qual cria e vende frangos.Entrou para o programa como membro do grupo Komakwatsi em finais de 2005, com um empréstimo inicial de 1.800 MT. Vai para o 5º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 4.000MT pagáveis em 5 meses com vista a reforçar o negócio uma vez que este se encontra um pouco enfraquecido devido a uma pausa provocada pela morte de um filho.

Translated from Portuguese by Daniel Foster, Kiva Volunteer.

Henriqueta Sebastião M., 42, is a single mother of 3 children and lives in the Albasine neighborhood on the outskirts of Maputo. She has a small aviary in her house where she raises and sells chickens. She joined [her MFI’s] program as member of the Komakwatsi group at the end of 2005 with an initial loan of $80USD. She is now going for her 5th loan and intends to borrow $175USD over 5 months in order to strengthen her business since it has been a weakened somewhat due to a lull caused by the death of her son.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Fatufua

texts.en: Fatufua comes from a family of five, She is 37 years of age, married, and has two children. Her family has been living on their plantation, which was their only source of income. Through years of hard work, they have improved their lives and managed to increase the size of their plantation. This is Fatufua second year with SPDB and this will be her second loan. In the future, Fatufua is planning to export her taro overseas and to renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her taro plantation

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru:
Nemat M., 53, is married and has 2 children. Nemat owns a sales location at “Korvon,” a large market in Dushanbe. For 2 years, he has been selling clothing for women. Nemat plans to use this loan to purchase new inventory of goods including winter clothing and shoes for children. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоев Немат, возраст – 53 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Имеет торговую точку на одном из крупных рынков города Душанбе под названием «Корвон». Товар которым он торгует – это женские вещи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый ассортимент товра, а именно зимние детские вещи и обувь. Так как на этом базаре люди в основном покупают товар большими пратиями, так как сюда съезжаются за покупками жители почти всего Таджикистана, они будут иметь возможность приобрести большое количество товра, для того чтобы потом продавать его в своих районах, тем самым получая прибыль и давая возможносьть местным приобретать необходимые им детские вещи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is 27 years old and joined SPBD Program when she heard stories from other women. She bought vegetable seeds from the Agriculture shop and started tending a garden. After three months, she started taking her vegetables to the market and she earned money to support her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
A few months ago, I was able to obtain public housing. To be frank, however, I feel that the house is very unsafe because the windows can be opened easily. I would like to install window safety bars, thus giving my family comfort and especially safety. I am requesting a loan of $550.00 USD to install window safety bars on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace poco tiempo que me entregaron mi casa pero la verdad la siento muy insegura ya que las ventanas se pueden abrir con mucha facilidad, me gustaría poner protecciones y así darle a mi familia comodidad y sobre todo seguridad”. Solicito $ 550.00 dlls para instalar protecciones en las ventanas de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Installation of home window safety bars

loans.name: Alikhan

texts.en: Alikhan M. is a 33-year-old trader who has a small food store in the small village of Saatli. He has seven years of experience in this field. He applied for $1200 USD to expand his business and diversify the products he sells.

loans.use: To diversify the products in his food store

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en: John, age 44, has a retail shop in his home village called Golola in Kiriri town, and it has been operational since 1997. He is married with 7 kids and cares for 1 grandson. This is the second time he is asking for a loan, and he is prompt with repayments. He plans to use the loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, baking flour, Vaseline, dry cells, airtime, cooking oil, and maize flour for his shop. His dream is to see his shop transform from stock of $800 to $2000 in the near future, and he believes he can only achieve this through your support.

loans.use: John plans to use the Kiva loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, baking flour, Vaseline, dry cells, airtime, cooking oil, and maize flour for his shop.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abiba T. was born in 1962 in Kourbongou in the prefecture of Tône (in the far north of Togo). She is married and is the mother of 6 children. She is in the cereal business in the Agoè open-air market. She has been in this business since 1983. She buys her millet, corn, and dried beans in the Kara region. Her customers re-sell the cereals as retailers.

She is requesting her first loan of US$ 1200 which will allow her to purchase 14 sacks of dried beans to add to her inventory of cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Abiba est née en 1962 à Kourbongou dans la préfecture de Tône (A l’extrême nord du Togo). Elle est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de céréales dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1983. Elle achète le mil, le maïs et du haricot dans la région de la Kara. Ses clients sont les revendeuses qui achètent et revendent en détail.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter 14 sacs de haricot pour augmenter son stock de céréales.

loans.use:
Purchase of 14 sacks of dried beans

Achat de 14 sacs d'haricot

loans.name: Essomededou

texts.fr:
Mr. Essomededou K. was born on 31 December 1983 in Assoukoko in the Prefecture of Blitta. He is married and has one child. He began a butcher shop in the Agoè neighbourhood in Lomé. His knowledge and way of greeting his customers leads to good sales. His plan is to buy 8 pigs in order to maintain his clientele ; it is for this reason he is asking for a loan of 300,000CFA.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Essomededou est né le 31 décembre 1983 à Assoukoko dans la préfecture de Blitta. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il a crée une charcuterie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son savoir faire et sa façon d’accueillir les clients lui permettent de bien vendre. Son projet est d’acheter 8 porcs afin de pouvoir maintenir sa clientèle ; c’est ainsi qu’il sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCFA.

loans.use: To buy pork to cook and sell to local workers.

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria started her business so she could have an activity and supply additional family income since she wanted to remodel her home and purchase furniture to make it more comfortable for her and her family. So she started offering footwear to friends and her husband's co-workers more than two years ago.

Gloria is requesting a loan of $250, which she plans to repay within three months, to purchase school shoes since that time of year is approaching and is when her sales increase. With your support Gloria can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Gloria inició el negocio para tener una actividad y un ingreso adicional al que le da su marido ya que ella deseaba acondicionar su casa y comprar muebles para estar mas comoda ella y su familia. Comenzó hace mas de 2 años ofreciendole calzado a los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo y amistades.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar zapatos escolares ya que se aproxima la temporada de graduaciones que es cuando sus ventas se incrementan. Con tu apoyo Gloria hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S., 50, and her husband, Mr. Nha In, 50, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1975 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. One of her children has full-time employment and the other three are enrolled in a local school.

Mrs. Sophal has been farming for over ten years. She grows melons, papayas, and corn in her farm not so far from her house. Her husband is a fisherman and does construction work when he has free time.

Sophal is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a boat for her husband's fishing, build a shelter for cows, and pay fees for renting more plots of land for farming.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for fishing, build a shelter for cows, and rent more plots of land for farming

loans.name: Ndefisiwa

texts.en:
Ndefisiwa is married with 3 children aged 17, 15, and 10. She also takes care of 2 other children. She has been a beans seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Ndefisiwa now hopes for a loan to buy more beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beans for re-sale

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Djiby D. est né en 1945 à Awgaly. il habite au quartier champs de course de Diourbel. Son activité principale c'est l'achat et la vente de bétail. il sollicite ce pret pour acheter de la nourriture de bétail.
texts.en:
Djiby D. was born in 1945 in Awgaly. He lives in the Champs de Course neighborhood in Diourbel. His main business is buying and selling livestock. He is asking for this loan to buy fodder for his animals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening livestock for re-sale

loans.name: Ni Komang Sutari

texts.id:
Even with no children to support, Sutari still needs to work hard for her retirement. Sutari participated in the pig farming program. From the capital of Rp.5.000.000, she bought 2 piglets, Rp. 3000.000 used to to buy pig feedings, and Rp.1000.000 to repair the pig sty. She lives with her husband Gede Natra at their own home. Her husband also help her with rearing the pigs. The profit from this pig farming, will be used to sustain their daily life, and increase their number of pigs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Bernard Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sudah tidak menanggung anak, Ni Komang Sutari tetap berusaha untuk kelanjutan hidupnya. Ni Komang Sutari bergabung dengan program ternak babi selama 6 bulan dan masa pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. Dengan modal pinjaman Rp.5.000.000,- Ni Komang Sutari membeli bibit babi sebanyak 2 ekor karena bibit sudah besar. Kandang yang dimiliki untuk memelihara babinya sangat sederhana, terbuat dari dinding bambu dan lantai semen. Selain membeli bibit babi, uang sejumlah Rp. 3000.000,- digunakan untuk membeli pakan. Sisa yang Rp.1000.000 untuk perbaiki kandang. Kadang - kadang pemberian pakan babi diselingi dengan makanan tradisional seperti: batang pisang, daun lantoro dan kangkung. Rumah yang dihuni sekarang bersama suaminya, Gede Natra, adalah rumah milik sendiri. Suami Sutari juga sering membantu istrinya memberi makan babinya. Semua keuntungan yang didapat digunakan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan juga untuk pengembangan usaha babinya.

loans.use: Membeli anak babi, pakan dan memperbaiki kandang

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo en la calle Caupolican de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de empanadas, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábado, el esposo es chofer asalariado.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un horno y así poder ella misma elaborar las empanadas ya que por el momento las obtiene de un horno público; ella indica que elaborando las empanadas en su propio horno mejorara sus ingresos y podrá ayudar a su familia.

Es cliente de Impro y por la actividad que desarrolla puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in her own home with her husband and son on Caupolican street in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz city. She sells empanadas Mondays through Saturdays, her husband is a salaried driver. The loan she seeks is to buy an oven so that she herself can make the empanadas because at the moment she gets them from a public oven. She tells us that making the empanadas in her own oven will improve her income and she will be able to help her family. She is a client of Impro and because of the work that she is developing she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an oven to bake her empanadas

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: O. Mavjuda lives in Khujand. She is married and has one child. Mrs. O. Mavjuda has been engaged in the commercial service and trade industry for a long time. She has experience in business and understands how the market works. Now Mrs. O. Mavjuda sells men’s and women’s jackets that she imports from Istaravshan. Mrs. O. Mavjuda is applying for a loan of 1000 STJ for 1 month to import new seasonal goods.

loans.use: new seasonal good importing

loans.name: Mohamed Edouard

texts.fr: Mohamed pratique un élevage de volaille à l'échelle familiale. Il habite au quartier Château d'Eau et arrive ,grâce à ses activités , à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforecr son élevage et faire du petit commerce.
texts.en:
Mohamed has a home-size poultry farm. He lives in the Château d'Eau district. Thanks to his work, he manages to provide for his family. He is requesting this loan to bolster his poultry-raising business and to conduct small-scale commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry and small-scale commerce

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 47, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband make and sell brooms in the local market. On average, they make a total of US$4 profit each day. The couple has four children, two who are students, one who is a garment worker and a fourth who is a farmer. Mrs. Sok S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport brooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Liem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liem P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Seng Socheat, is a vet in the local village. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate lotus. In this plantation, he does not have enough lotus seed to grow. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Liem P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more lotus seed for her husband’s plantation. She hopes to increase income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more lotus seed for her husband’s plantation.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La Señora Paula T. M. tiene 60 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Paula tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Paula es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace mas de seis años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio sus inicios surgen por que su Mama le enseño este oficio y ella lo ha tomado como medio de supervivencia para su familia. Doña Paula tiene los propósitos de mantener a sus clientes ya que estos le solicitan variedad de productos y además tiene que cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado a la compra de materia prima como tela, hilo, agujas, encajes y tijeras. Los deseos son de mejorar cada día en la elaboración de sus sabanas, delantales y shorts. La cantidad necesaria es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula T. M. is 60 years old and single. Paula has three children, who all work. She works as a seamstress, and has done so for more than six years. She began when her mother taught her this skill, and she took it up as a means of supporting her family. Paula hopes to keep her clients, who seek a variety of products, and with whose orders she must comply. The funding is for working capital--she needs to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, needles, scissors and lace. Her wish is to improve every day in her production of sheets, aprons and shorts. She needs 9,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sirena

texts.en:
Sirena sells souvenirs, gift sets and other retail items in the central market in Beregovo. She usually offers a big variety of merchandise for sale in her vending kiosk. Sirena has been in business for about five years. Currently, she has about $2000 in turnover capital. Her net profit is about $270. 

Sirena dreams of developing her business and becoming more independent. She would like to get a loan of $200 to buy more goods for her business. She believes that additional income will help her develop her business to the point that she will be able to complete her mortgage payments on the business. 

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 6 weeks.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Mrs. Margie B. is 47 years old, married and lives at Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with only one child. Her husband is a furniture maker and furniture making is their source of income. It started with only PHP 3,000 in capital from Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative. She became a member last September 2008 and has had loans up to fourth cycle already. Because of the quality of the furniture they produce, their customers have increased from time to time. Other sources of income are hog raising and farming. Mrs. B. is applying for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy lumber for furniture making and additional goods for a sari-sari store. Someday, she looks forward to a successful business and a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy lumber for furniture making and additional goods for a sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gwantina

texts.en:
Gwantina is a fruit seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Nzovwe '1' group loan and currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day, she works 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruits for sale, hoping to expand her business.

Gwantina is hopeful that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. She is 32 years old and married, and she has three children, ages four, six, and 12.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Shafique Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Shafique wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Munir, Jamila and Nasreen want loans to buy buffaloes for their milk selling business.

Shafique is the group leader. Her husband, R. runs a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo but now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to increase the profit of her dairy business. They are citizens of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan.

This is a group loan. Loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the entire loan. If one member does not repay, other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha D., 31, resides in the Kampong Cham Province where, as a house wife, she takes care of the home and looks after her three young children, two of whom are in school and one who is yet too young to attend.  Her husband, 32, pictured here, is a pig farmer who typically makes $14 in revenue per day. Monthly, this family spends about $45 on food, $15 on the children’s education and around $25 on transportation. To earn more income, Pha D. is asking for a loan of $1000 for her husband to raise pigs and purchase pig feed. This loan will ultimately help the family raise its standard of living.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Nyakatonzi Misike Faith Group

texts.en: M. Faith is 27 years of age, married with one child who goes to school.  She has operated a drug shop business for over six years.  M. will use her loan to purchase various drugs recommended by the national drugs authority to meet her customers’ needs and to expand her drug shop.  M. is a hardworking lady whose dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: Expand her drug shop business.

loans.name: Mutiatu

texts.en: Mutiatu, 39 years old and married with four children, sells bottles. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bottles to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles to sell.

loans.name: Diadiaratou

texts.fr:
Madame  Diadiaratou B. a 36 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six enfants à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Diadiaratou B.  après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initiée à  l’activité d’achat et  de vente d’huile alimentaire il y a maintenant douze  ans. Elle mène cette activité à domicile et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose une grande table sur laquelle elle vend ses marchandises. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Soro yiriwa de Banconi), elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 15 bidons d’huile alimentaire  dans les huileries de place avant de les revendre en détail, au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes surtout. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diadiaratou B., 36, lives in a big family with her husband and her 6 children in Banconi, an outlying neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Diadiaratou B., after having tried several businesses without success, began buying and selling food-grade oil 12 years ago. She conducts this business out of her home and in the neighborhood market, where she has a big table on which she sells her merchandise. She is much in demand with her clientele due to the quality of her products.

In order to satisfy this ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, 5 years ago. After 2 solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association in her neighborhood, (Association Soro yiriwa of Banconi), she is on her 5th individual loan, and all the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan she intends to buy 15 jerrycans of food-grade oil in the local oil factories to be resold retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000 F CFA with this loan. The profit will be used essentially to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cooking oil for re-sale

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en: L. Leah is a 30-year-old married mother of 2 children aged 8 and 2. She also cares for 3 dependants. She has been a business lady with a drug shop in the Matale trading centre for 8 years. Her biggest challenges are the debtors that take drugs and do not want to pay in time, the high rental expenses, and her seasonal customers. Leah is seeking her 29th loan from Pearl Microfinance in order to restock her drug shop. At the moment, she is able to make 300,000 Ugandan shillings (or about $150) per month in profits. This has enabled her to educate her children and cater for their clothing needs on time and whenever the need arises.

loans.use: To increase her stock of drugs in her drug store.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Kidumu borrower group in Kiboriloni,Kilimanjaro. She is 32  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 9 years old.

Ester has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 10 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ester`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Warly

texts.en: Failure was not absent in Warly D. P.’s life but he is eager to go on and nowhere near quitting. Warly, a 35-year-old married man with two children, is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He is cultivating a three-hectare rice field, where main income of his family comes from. In lack of farm inputs, Warly is requesting for a loan of Php10, 000. This will help Warly in maintaining the farm he is tending and also pay for the laborers.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Lumuli A Tusubira Babirye Group

texts.en: T. Babirye is fifty years old; a widow blessed with six children the last born still schooling. She has four dependents that she is taking care of and they are schooling too. She is involved in brick making activity where by it is so far three years while making bricks. She is requesting for the loan to purchase iron sheets to make a shade for her bricks, pay the wages to people who normally help her and so forth. She is a hardworking business woman trying very hard to educate her children and more so her dream is to purchase car.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to make a shade for her bricks, pay the wages to people who normally help her and so forth.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is a widow and she is saddled with the responsibility of taking care of her 3 children alone. She sells sachet water and sarongs at retail prices to her customers in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes to receive the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more supplies of sachet water and sarongs to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of sachet water and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ourt

texts.en:
Ourt E. makes a living by buying vegetables from local farmers for stock, earning approximately $6 US per day. He is 33 years old and married with three school-age children. His wife works full-time growing crops, earning $5 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. He resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia with his wife (pictured) and children. 
Mr. E. and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, E. is asking for a loan of $800 US to purchase more vegetables to sell to the markets. This is his first loan from Kiva’s partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with three children. She is forty years old and a trader. She runs a mother care shop and has sold assorted child care materials like dippers, napkins, pampers, soaps, etc. for about ten years now. She does not have sufficient working capital to run her business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase mother care products in bulk.

loans.name: Ghetelemu Group

texts.en:
Aloysius D. is the leader of a group of four borrowers called the Ghetelemu Group. He is 43 years old and single. He has four children aged 9 to 18 years old, and their educational levels range from kindergarten through twelfth grade. He also cares for three of his siblings. Aloysius is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support. He lives and works in the Gbartala community, about 20 kilometers from Gbarnga City, which is the capital of Bong County, Liberia.

His business is a tea shop. He owns this tea shop, where he sells tea, bread, coffee, fried eggs and other food items to residents of his community. Aloysius has been running this business for three years, and is hoping to expand his business to a bigger shop where customers can be comfortable while they eat. Aloysius needs this loan to purchase more supplies to improve his business. He dreams of giving his children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies to improve his business

loans.name: Elisa Maria

texts.es: Elisa es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, ella tiene 25 años de edad a pesar de ser una persona tan joven ha logrado establecerse con este medio de vida. Su actividad económica es la venta de calzado, hace4 mas de 4 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio, por lo que ella realiza un sin número de publicidad para atraer a sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, zapatos para niños, por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña y la afluencia de clientes es muy buena. Su deseo es construir su vivienda ya que hasta los momentos no ha podido realizarlo.
texts.en:
Elisa is a very responsible woman who really enjoys her work. She is 25. In spite of being so young, she has established herself in this part of life. She has been selling footwear for over four years. She does an uncountable amount of publicity to attract her customers. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy sandals, slippers, athletic shoes, and shoes for children. The Christmas season is approaching, and the influx of customers is very good. Her wish is to build a house. Up until now she has not been able to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sandals, slippers, athletic shoes, and shoes for children

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Ernalyn E. is 35 years old, married, and lives in Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to Tomas E., who is a farmer and laborer. They have been blessed with a child, who is now in elementary school. Mrs. E. has helped her husband support their child by running a sari-sari (or variety) store. Her business has done well for more than three years, and she is earning enough money to meet her goals. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year because she was interested in the products and services we offer, and aware of an award we won in 2006. She has applied for a new loan, for PHP 4,000, to expand her store, care for her child, and pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to improve her sari-sari store

loans.name: Barisiima Group, Central

texts.en: S. Juliet is 50 years old and married with four children; she also takes care of two orphans. Juliet is a businesswoman who has had a wholesale shop in Lweza for one year.  Although the business is faced with a lot of price fluctuations, she is able to make a 200,000 UGX weekly profit, which is mostly attributed to good customer care and the help of loans. Juliet dreams of ensuring that her business continues to grow and of having a prosperous family. Juliet needs a loan to be able to restock her wholesale shop with more goods.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her wholesale shop

loans.name: Esmirna 4-5 Group

texts.en:
Greysy is the coordinator of her group, Esmirna, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Greysy is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by investing in a line of hair products (including shampoos, rinses and dyes) to sell in her salon as well as in an iron for straightening hair. She will use the profits to invest in her home by continuing construction to complete her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and a hair iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Adelia Jossias

texts.pt:
Adélia jossias B. nasceu em Inhambane, tem 31 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de uma rapariga de 13 anos e vai à escola. Responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela em sua casa e consegue poupar por mês 1.500.00MT  porque conta com ajuda do seu marido que e proprietário de uma mina de extração de pedra lage (pedra preciosa).

Adélia muda se para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia com a irmã mais velha alegando que iam estudar, apos sua chegada não consegue engrenar a escola por falta de documentos (estavão incompletos) então junta se com seu marido e vai ao lar. Seu marido emigra para África do Sul deixa lhe com um fundo e ela inicia seu próprio negócio e consegue construir sua própria barraca em Jermantino uma localidade que dista 7 km da vila e tem muita aderência por se encontrar na estrada principal. Anos depois o marido regressa e optam em comprar um terreno de extração de pedra Lages (pedra preciosa) e ele também decide ficar a cuidar do seu negócio pessoalmente. Conta com ajuda de 5 trabalhadores que auferem 1.500.00MT mensalmente, mas devido à obra ela fica na beira da falência e pede ajuda a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00MT para reforçar o negócio. Tem como melhor produto o (peixe, feijão, bebidas e refrigerantes) gastando em cada viagem uma média de 10.000.00MT e tem de lucro mensal 4.000.00MT.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Adélia na Hluvuku e Kiva. Estes 8.000.00MT serão usados para comprar produtos da sua loja. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para aumentar as ferramentas para extração de pedra Lages porque as que têm já estão gastas.
texts.en:
Adelia Jossias B. was born in Inhambane. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her 13-year-old daughter, who attends school. She also cares for 2 nephews who live with her in her home. Each month she manages to put 1500 Meticales in savings because she is helped out financially by her husband, who owns a rhyolite mine. Adelia moved with her older sister to Vila de Namaacha on the border with Swaziland, thinking that they would go to school there. After they arrived, however, they couldn't enroll in school because of a lack of complete documentation. She then met her husband and moved in with him. Her husband emigrated to South Africa and left her with some funds, which she used to start her own business. She was able to set up a stall in Jermantino, which is 7 kilometers from her town and is very popular because it is located on the main road. After some years, Adelia's husband returned and they decided to buy land on which they could mine rhyolite. He decided to stay in order to take care of his business personally. Adelia has 5 workers to help her, who earn 1500 Meticales per month. However, because of the cost of the mine construction, Adelia is barely able to cover all her expenses and she has asked Hluvuku for a loan in the amount of 8000 Meticales to strengthen her business. Her best products are fish, beans, and drinks. She earns 4000 Meticales each month, and spends 10,000 Meticales each time she travels. This is Adelia's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The 8000 Meticales will be used to buy products for her store. She is confident that she will repay the loan promptly. She will then ask for another loan to acquire more tools for extracting the rhyolite, because the ones she currently has are worn down,

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans and drinks.

loans.name: Reun

texts.en: Mrs. S. is married with four children. She lives in a commune located in Siem Reap Province. She fishes with her husband in a local lake and river, which provides them with enough fish for their family. S. always wakes up early in the morning to go fishing and is back home in the late evening. She then sells the fish that she has caught in the lake from her house. Since fishing is the family's main source of income, S. is requesting a loan of $300 USD to purchase more fishing tools, such as nets and traps, to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools, such as nets and traps

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 33-year-old married man and father of 2 young children. He is an experienced car painter with almost 15 years of experience. After getting the needed skill, he opened a car painting shop in his hometown. He is the only provider for the family with his business income. 

Today, Richard is planning to enlarge his business operation; and he needs to borrow $1,000 to purchase a new painting compressor and so he will be able to take additionA. number of cars. And he hopes that with the help of the loan, his business will grow in the next year.

loans.use: purchase a new painting compressor

loans.name: Tawopanneh Group

texts.en:
This group is named Tawopanneh, a Temne phrase meaning: “Let us hold ourselves together”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to further strengthen their businesses.

The leader of the group is forty-two-year-old John K., pictured in the middle in the group photo. Born in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone, John is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. John sells used-clothes and has been running this business for two years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy a bale of used-clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used-clothes to add to his stock

loans.name: Angela Marilu

texts.es:
Ángela de 20 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil como una microempresaria ya que una de sus actividades económicas es la de hacer manualidades a base de formix.

Comenzó a realiza muñecos de fomix desde que salió del colegio. Por las buenas referencias que tuvo comenzó a trabajar para una empresa. En la actualidad es una microempresaria ya que sigue proveyendo a empresas de las manualidades que hace. Tiene un horario de trabajo cómodo ya que puede dedicarle tiempo a sus estudios. Las manualidades que realiza son para eventos específicos como fiestas, cumpleaños etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix, espuma para hacer más manualidades y así seguir creciendo en la microempresa. De esa manera el objetivo de ella es automatizar la microempresa y así seguir creciendo como microempresaria hasta llegar a ser reconocida a nivel nacional por los productos que ella elabora que son hechos a base de fomix.
texts.en:
Ángela is 20 years old and lives in an urban area called Guasmo de Guayaquil, where she has a small business. One of her economic activities is making handicrafts from Fomix (a type of crafting foam). She began to make foam dolls when she graduated from high school; she was able to start working for a company because of her good personal references. She now has her own business, and continues to supply her crafts to various companies. She has a comfortable working schedule that allows her to dedicate time to her studies. The crafts she makes are for specific events like parties, birthdays, etc. With this loan, she wants to buy Fomix and foam for more handicrafts so that she can continue to grow her business. Her goal is to automate her small business so that she can continue to expand until she is recognized on a national level for the Fomix products she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Foam to make handicrafts

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: La solicitante es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Cuenta con casa propia de material noble y posee una buena acumulacion de bienes; tiene ingresos diversificados. Posee una bodega surtida en la que venden todo tipo de productos. Alquila cuartos; posee un automovil que trabaja en la empresa de transportes Magister´s la cual es manejada por su esposo (chofer). Tiene buena experiencia crediticia con la CMAC ICA. El destino del credito es para incremento de capital.
texts.en:
The applicant is married. She has 2 children of school age. She has her own well-made house and she possesses a good accumulation of goods. She has diversified incomes. She has a well-stocked convenience store in which she sells all kinds of products. She rents rooms and possesses an automobile that she uses in the Magister´s transportation company which is driven by her husband (the chauffeur). She has a good credit history with the CMAC ICA. The loan will be used to as capital to grow her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to grow her businesses (a store, a transportation and a rental business)

loans.name: Dolele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DOLELE est un des groupes de  solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 18 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de deux enfants exceptée Lobé M. (responsable du groupe), mais elle a l'entière charge d'un de ses neveux qui fréquente l'école. Le groupe est constitué de femmes relativement âgées de 21 à 40 ans, seules les quatre premières au second rang sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite ont plus de la quarantaine. Elles développent des activités diverses, à savoir le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques et certaines font de l'élevage de volailles et de l'embouche ovine.

Madame Adji Aïda M., pour des raisons liées à la santé de son enfant n'a pas pu être présente lors de la prise de photo. Elle est adjointe à la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 21 ans. Elle fait de l'élevage de volaille et l'embouche ovine et elle est appuyée par son mari pour mener à bien son activité.

Mademoiselle Lobé M., en deuxième position, accroupie au premier rang de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo et mise en médaillon, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est la plus jeune du groupe mais c'est dû à son assiduité, son sérieux dans le travail et sa bonne culture d'esprit de solidarité qu'elle a été responsabilisée. Elle est âgée de 21 ans et célibataire sans enfant mais à la charge de garçon de sa sœur. Depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en 2009 elle vend des parfums et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de développer et promouvoir son activité. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne, de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de l'enfant dont elle a la charge.
texts.en:
The DOLELE group is one of the solidarity groups of the RANDOULENE SUD "Banc Villageois." It is made up of eighteen women, all from the same neighborhood. They are all married and the mothers of at least two children, with the exception of Lobé M. (group leader); however, she is entirely responsible for one of her nephews, who is in school. The women of the group are between 21 and 40 years old, with the exception of the first four standing on the left, who are in their forties. They are developing diverse businesses, such as sales of clothing, cosmetics, and fishing supplies. Others raise poultry and fatten sheep. For reasons related to the health of her child, Mrs. Adji Aïda M. could not be present for the photo. She is assistant group leader; she is 21 years old. She raises poultry and fattens sheep, and she is assisted in her business by her husband. Miss Lobé M., second from the right on the front row and also in closeup, is the group leader. She is the youngest of the group, but she became group leader thanks to her diligence, dependability, and understanding of community spirit. She is 21 years old, single, and childless, although she supports her sister's son. Since joining the "Banc Villageois" in 2009, she has been selling perfume. Her new loan will allow her to develop and market her business. Her goals are to build her savings level and to pay her personal expenses, as well as those of the child she supports.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the business activities of group members

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo tiene 69 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de  48 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público. En un inicio tenía que arrendar un carro, pero con el pasar del tiempo logró comprarse uno, actualmente contrata un chofer para que realice la rutas indicadas, siendo él mismo quien administra sus ganancias. Procura cada cierto tiempo, darle mantenimiento necesario para que su vehículo este en optimas condiciones. Durante este tiempo de trabajo, le ha sido muy rentable por lo que desea mas adelante adquirir otro carro. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, además le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la reparación de su carro.
texts.en:
Segundo, age 69, lives with his wife and their three children in his own house. He has been providing public transportation services for over 48 years. In the beginning he had to rent a car. But, with the passage of time, he was able to buy one. He currently hires a driver to drive the indicated routes. Segundo manages his earnings himself. He tries to perform the needed maintenance every so often so that his vehicle is in optimal condition. This era of work has been very profitable for him. That is why he wishes to get another car later on. This is his fifth loan with MFP. It pleases him to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are very responsible people, and they are very supportive. He will use the loan he is requesting to repair his car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy two new machines

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando B. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Baribad. He is 40 years old. Orlando is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Orlando owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Orlando has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Orlando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Orlando is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Orlando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old and married. Vilma is involved in farming. She says she first learned planting and harvesting rice crops from her parents, who were farmers also. Now, she and her husband maintain their own farm. She also plants fruit trees like pomelo trees. She sells her harvest to the market.

Vilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm needs. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Vilma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm needs

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak S. is a 42-year-old woman residing in a stone house located in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She now has three children. One of them is already married and lives independently and the other two are single. 

To pursue a daily income, Chak S. has several sewing machines that she uses to sew or repair clothes for her villagers. She also buys cloth and turns it into sets of men's and ladies' clothes. In addition, she hires out clothes to people for their wedding parties. She sometimes receives help with the sewing from her children. 

Chak S. needs a loan to buy cloth and sewing equipment to perform her tailoring service.

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda M., 55, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Faustino, a carpenter, and the mother of two hard-working young adults. By the grace of God, Yolanda has managed to support her children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a variety store where she also sells native breakfast fare and other items. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience outlet which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small amounts to people who live in the neighborhood. It is the place where you go to buy one package of shampoo, for example, or a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She generates her income by buying supplies wholesale and selling at retail.  Her store is next to her house and her regular customers are neighbors and people who live in her community.  She generates a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use this loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in income from this expansion of her business.
  
Yolanda dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, and faithfully meets up with co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who come together to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her small general store

loans.name: Nora Pilar

texts.es:
Nora de 41 años, vende hilos al por mayor y menor a distintas tiendas y talleres de costura. Vive con su esposo quien viaja para promocionar el hilo a tiendas fuera de la ciudad y con sus hijos en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ya tiene 6 años comercializando hilos a diferentes tiendas y talleres de confesión y costura debido que su suegro le enseño como hacer hilos ella copio esta carrera para mantener a su familia. Mientras que ella hace el hilo otra persona le ayuda enrollando y cortando el hilo para ser empaquetado, trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Tiene una producción de mas o menos 2000 hilos. 

Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar materiales, cartón e hilos para mejorar las ventas de su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar una maquina rebobinadota y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nora, 41 years old, sells thread wholesale and retail to stores and sewing workshops. She lives with her husband, who travels to promote their thread to stores outside the city, and their children in the Guayaquil Suburb (an urban zone where the majority of inhabitants are informal merchants).

She has already been selling threads for six years to different stores and workshops. Her father-in-law taught her how to make thread, and she took up this career to maintain her family. While she makes the thread, another person helps her, rolling and cutting the thread so it can be packaged. They work from 8am to 4pm every day. They produce approximately 2,000 threads.

With the loan, she wants to buy materials, cardboard, and threads in order to improve her business sales. In the future, she would like to buy a bobbin machine and expand her business.

loans.use: Thread, cardboard

loans.name: Will Alfredo

texts.es:
Will de 28 años de edad, reside con su esposa y sus tres hijos  en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán, sus hijos tienen las edades de 6, 5 y el último de meses de edad, se dedica las estructuras metálicas y posee un taller donde realiza todos sus trabajos. Will comenzó como empleado en un taller pero le surgió la idea de tener uno propio y dio inicio desde hace 3 años trabajando todo el día con la ayuda de algunos amigos a los que contrata para salir con todo el trabajo; su dificultad es que no cuenta con la solvencia económica para comprar hierro y almacenar en su inventario para estar preparado al momento que los clientes le soliciten trabajo.
Esta situación ha llevado a Will a solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a comprar los materiales para desempeñar su trabajo como hierro, lijas, pintura y discos para la pulidora, de esta manera el tendrá su inventario en buenas condiciones, listo para realizar cualquier trabajo en un momento determinado.
Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan en buenas condiciones, que todos se preparen para seguir adelante con nuevas oportunidades, con el negocio su esperanza es seguir creciendo con entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Will is 28 years old and lives with his wife and three children in San Francisco Gotera, Department of Morazán. His two older children are six and five years of age, while the youngest is only a few months old. Will builds metal structures and has a workshop where he performs all of his work. He started out as an employee at another workshop until he came up with the idea to start his own business. Will established his business three years ago and hired some friends so that he could succeed in his work. His difficulty is that he lacks the financial resources to buy iron to maintain his inventory so that he can be ready whenever his customers need work performed.

This situation has forced Will to request a loan to help him buy the materials needed for his work such as iron, sandpaper, paint, and sanding disks so that his inventory will be well-stocked. These supplies will allow him to be ready to begin work at any given moment. His dream is for his children to grow up in a good environment and prepare them for new opportunities. With his business, Will hopes to continue growing with enthusiasm.

loans.use: Purchase iron, sandpaper, paint, and sanding disks

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa R. sells onions, beans and tomatoes at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and groundnuts to sell. She is 42 years old and married to a farmer. She has 5 children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Parioti Ene

texts.en:
Parioti Ene has been raising livestock in Naivasha town for the last three years. She is 46 years old and a widow who takes care of her two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 goats and 10 sheep, which she will raise and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Parioti hopes to increase her income and be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: To buy 15 goats and 10 sheep

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 29 años de edad, es separado, vive en casa de sus padres y tiene a su cargo un pequeño hijo. Reside en el el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona situada aproximadamente a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un pequeño taller de mecánica en donde brinda servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos motorizados, adicionalmente complementa esta actividad con la venta de repuestos para vehículos. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad actualmente cuenta con una clientela bastante fidelizada. El complementa sus actividades realizando trabajos agrícolas y con los ingresos que percibe se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y mantener a su menor hijo.

Marcos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más repuestos y herramientas, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera implementar su negocio y mejorar su atención.
texts.en:
Marcos is 29 years old.  He is separated and lives in his parents' house where he takes care of his young son.  He lives in La Esperanza sector of Reque district.  This area is located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Marcos has a small garage where he repairs and services vehicles.  In addition to this, he also sells vehicle spare parts.  Owing to the amount of time he has been working in this business, he currently has quite a loyal customer base.  He supplements his businesses by doing farm work and he uses the profits he makes to get his family ahead and support his young son.

Marcos would like to expand his business by purchasing more spare parts and tools.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which he hopes to keep his business going and improve his customer service.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and tools

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Samuel; El socio tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera, El socio se dedica  a la compra y venta de cerámicas, el es artesano y elabora en base de arcilla, trabajos artísticos para la venta, el tiene un stand en el cual exhibe sus trabajos y también los vende a otros colegas para la venta de artesanía local. El socio requiere el préstamo para poder incrementar su capital y comprar materiales para la elaboración de artesanía el compra desde los materiales básico hasta las pintura y renueva sus pinceles. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de artesanía.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Samuel, 40, is a member of the “INTI QUILLA” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province.

His is single and is a ceramics merchant.  He’s an artisan making artistic objects out of clay to sell.   He has a stand where he displays his works and also those of colleagues for local crafts sales.

He needs the loan to increase capital to buy materials and supplies to make his crafts.  He buys everything from basic materials to paint and new brushes.  He needs the loan to buy crafts materials and supplies.

He is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Tesie

texts.en:
Tesie P. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Tesie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tesie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Tesie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:
