HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Danelia tiene su actividad que es un quiosco. Inicio hace mas de 3 años en este negocio, por lo que siempre le hs gustado ofrecer una buena calidad de sus productos. Tiene 7 hijos y solamente uno está a su cargo.  Es una persona muy jovial y emprendedora que disfruta de su medio de vida, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de pedidos. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, platanitos, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos y pan. Desea mejorar cada día más las condiciones de vida de su familia.  
07/02/11
texts.en: Danielle's business activity is a kiosk. She began this business more than 3 years ago, and she has always liked to offer good quality products. She has 7 children, but only one is still in her care. She is a very cheerful and hard-working person who enjoys her way of life. The majority of her customers ask her for a great variety of items. This loan will be used to buy candies, little bananas, juices, soda water, soft drinks, and bread. She wants more and more to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Working capital to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a 56-year-old married man with eight children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the honey business for two years; he started with 1,000,000 shillings but expanded to 1,500,000 shillings. 

His hardships are high transport costs, price fluctuation and increased rent. His vision is to supply the western region of the country, plus educating his children. Abdul intends to use the loan to buy jerrycans of honey for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing  jerrycans of honey for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a shop and progress his business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling of jewelry/gold plating and buying and selling gold.  She lives in Toledo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Juliana is borrowing PHP 25,000 to fund operations. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juliana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rosena

texts.en:
Rosena is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosena is 38 years old. 

Rosena has a used clothing/sales business in the Philippines. Rosena requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase used clothes to sell.

Rosena has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, Rosena would like to send her children to school to get better jobs.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a produce trader, a business in which he has been involved for 15 years, having begun as a subsistence farmer. Godfrey wants to educate his children and build a permanent house. He is requesting a loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Eldeniz

texts.ru: Eldeniz jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas vmeste s jenoy i detmi projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Eldeniz K. 29 let. On uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov. Eldeniz iz poluchennoko moloko ot korov delayet yogurti i kefir potom prodayot ix v magazini. Yeqo molochniye produkti shitayustay ochen xoroshimi.
texts.en: Eldeniz is married and has one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in Fuzuli region with his wife and child.  Eldeniz K. is 29 years old.  He has been raising cattle for four years.  Now, he needs 2300 AZN to buy a cow.  With the milk he receives, Eldeniz makes yogurt and kefir to sell in stores.  His dairy products are considered very high quality.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Luzvilla is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzvilla owns & operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Luzvilla has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luzvilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzvilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional soft drinks, dried fish and noodles for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luzvilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, dried fish and noodles to sell

loans.name: Loeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Loeurng is a local farmer who has spent most of her life cultivating rice on her fertile land. From her crop planting business, she earns around US$2.5 each day to cover expenses such as utilities, food  and education. To generate extra income, her husband works as a garment factory worker and he gets a monthly salary. As the rainy season is coming, Mrs. Loeurng would like a loan to buy some farm inputs needed for her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 42-years-old mother of two daughters and three sons. Her oldest son graduated and wanted to have his own job, so she helped using her savings to rent a store and prepare it to become a grocery store. 

Fayza's son (who appears in the picture here instead of his conservative mother) needs to purchase more goods and to use the other half of the store, so his mother took out a loan from FATEN to purchase and install shelves in the store. 

Fayza's husband has retired therefore the store is the only source of income for the seven members family.

loans.use: to purchase and install shelves and prepare the entire space of the store to show grocery items

loans.name: Solidario La Tinajita Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO LA TINAJITA
EL GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SOCIAS CELESTINA, ESTELA Y BERTILA LAS TRES YA OBTUVIERON UN CREDITO ANTERIOR CON FAPE, FUERON MUY CUMPLIDAS EN SUS PAGOS,CELESTINA ES SOLTERA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. GUIPILES A MANO, ESTELA TAMBIEN ES SOLTERA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. GUIPILES  Y A LA VENTA D. PAPAS FRITAS SU CARRETA LA SACA  EN LA TARD. PARA PODER VENDER SUS PAPAS, BERTILA ES CASADA TIENE DOS HIJAS PEQUEÑAS, ELLA SE DEDICA ALA ELABORACION D. GUIPILES A MANO Y  TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SIEMBRAN ARVEJA  LAS TRES SOCIAS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA D. MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION D. GUIPILES.
texts.en:
'La Tinajita' solidarity group.

This group is maD. up of the following members: Celestina, Estela and Bertila.  These three ladies have already received a previous loan from FAPE and were very punctual in making their repayments.

Celestina is single and makes 'guipiles' (traditional blouses) by hand.  Estela is also single.  She makes 'guipiles' and sells fries from a cart.  She takes her cart out in the afternoons in order to sell her fries.  Bertila is married and has two young daughters.  She makes 'guipiles' by hand and also farms.  She and her husband grow peas.  The three members of this group are requesting a loan to buy raw materials for making 'guipiles'.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making 'guipiles' (traditional blouses)

loans.name: Meerimby's Group

texts.en:
Meerimby, 35, is the treasurer of this group. She is divorced and has two kids, the youngest of whom is only eight months old. Meerimby resides in the town of Uzgen. Her parents help her run a small business growing and selling agricultural products. The business was started 17 years ago when her family received land during privatization. At that time, she also had a cow and a calf, which helped to produce dairy products too. Their monthly income is 3 000 soms and their initial capital was only 500 soms. She applied for a loan in order to buy construction materials to build a small house for her and her children. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is a 47-year-old Rwanda entrepreneur who is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 22. All of her children are in school and she and her husband are both farmers. 

Vestine has worked as a farmer for the past 5 years and sells foodstuffs.She requires a loan in order to purchase a milling machine. This machine will help her generate enough profits so that she can begin constructing a family house.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is aspiring to something better for his family. He is an inspiration to them by working all day long to generate income.  In the morning, he goes up to the field. Virgilio raises crops. He plants and harvests rice for future sale. He has been doing it for almost five years. At the last crop in May, he earned P20,000. In the afternoon, after going to the field, he operates a motorcycle transport service for the people in his village for additional income.


He wants his crop to yield more, and that is why he is requesting a loan of P10,000 to pay for labor costs in sowing and transplanting rice seedlings for his farm.  With the help of this loan, he will thoroughly prepare his farmland for the next planting season.  He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest every season.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in sowing and transplanting rice seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Coumba Mané

texts.fr: -Madame Coumba  est une femme mariée, âgé d’une cinquantaine d’année. Elle vit au Sénégal  et s’active dans la location des chambres. Elle a choisit son activité par nécessité afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins. Elle trouve beaucoup de plaisir à aider les gens à trouver un logement. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2000.Elle y a déjà remboursée trois prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 destiné à réaliser quelques travaux dans sa maison. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer l’état des chambres qu’elle met en location et  le cadre de vie chez elle. L’augmentation de ses besoins lui permettra de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et de mieux aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba is a 50-something year old married woman who lives in Senegal. She is active in renting out rooms. She chose this business by necessity in order to support herself. She finds a great deal of joy in helping people find lodging. 

Ms. Coumba has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2000. There, she has already repaid three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 for completing some work in her house. This will enable her to improve the rooms that she rents out, as well as her living conditions at home. Increasing (her revenues) will allow her to meet her personnel needs and to help out her family further.

loans.use: to renovate a room to rent out

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José Vicente tiene 42 años de edad es soltero vive con los hijos de quince, trece años de edad en el  Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Los Miembros de la VRC Voluntad de Dios, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad la cría, Parroquia Guanujo a una distancia de 20 minutos perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la Agricultura y ganadería.

José se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene casa propia, 3 hectareas de terreno, siembra papas, maíz, trigo, habas, alverja además cría otras especies de animales como cerdos, ovejas pollos y cuyes. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda

Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos para plagas, insumos y  para sembrar papas e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando.
 
Su sueño es comprar más tierra para poder sembrar más y ampliar la producción, tener una vida tranquila y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta las festividades del carnaval y las del sector.
texts.en:
José Vicente is 42 years old. He is single and lives with his children, who are thirteen and fifteen, in the Guaranda canton of Bolívar province.

The members of the Voluntad de Dios (Will of God) communal bank are in the La Cría community, 20 minutes away from the parish of Guanujo in the Guaranda canton. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture and cattle ranching.

José farms and and raises cattle. He has his own house and 3 hectares of land, and he grows potatoes, corn, wheat, beans, and peas. He also raises other animal species such as pigs, sheep, chickens, and guinea pigs. He buys and sells his products in the city of Guaranda.

He is asking for the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and supplies, and to plant potatoes and increase his business. The loan will help him to supply his economic necessities and improve his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as fluctuations in prices for the products he sells, as well as the abrupt changes in climate that we are going through.

His dream is to purchase more land in order to be able to plant more and increase production, to have a tranquil life, and to move his children forward.

He likes the festivities of the carnival and those of the group.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and supplies, and to plant potatoes and increase his business

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente,  Mónica vive en la misma ciudad donde y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Ya son quince años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Mónica requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes y aretes. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mónica was born in Cusco department.  She is 43 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage.  Mónica currently lives in the same city in which she was born and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Her business is selling beauty products.  She has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Mónica needs a loan to buy more cosmetics such as, for example, perfume and earrings.  

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, perfume and earrings

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en una localidad muy concurrida de personas. Ella de dedica a la compra de chatarra, plástico y cobre acompañada por su compañero de vida quien maneja el pick up, van de colonia tras colonia pregonando con un altavoz que compran dichos productos y luego los venden a compañias que se encargan de reciclar los mismos y procesarlos en nueva materia prima; además posee tienda y venta de verduras en su residencia que es atendida cuando ella no se encuentra en el lugar por sus hijos que ya colaboran en la actividad productiva del hogar, se ha hecho de muchos clientes pues es toda una mujer comerciante, sabe cómo invertir para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela y para poder obtener mejores ganancias, además de vender productos de buena calidad y tiene precios accesibles;  María es toda una mujer de negocios  siempre se mantiene activa y le da el mejor servicio a las personas; actualmente le ofrecen vender mayor cantidad de chatarra a un precio con el que ella puede obtener una muy buena ganancia y por ello se encuentra solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprarla, además reinvertir en la compra de verduras y productos de primera necesidad para su tienda. María tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor vida para su familia que bien merecido lo tiene con tanto trabajo.
texts.en:
49-year old María lives with her husband and children in a densely populated area. She earns her living buying scrap metal, plastic, and copper. She is accompanied by her husband who drives the pick up truck. They go from village to village using a loud speaker to explain what they buy, and then they sell the items to recycling companies who turn the items into new products. 

In addition María runs a store selling vegetables out of her home. When she is not at home, her children take over since they are all involved in running the household. She has many customers as she is a good businesswoman. She knows what to buy in order to satisfy her customers' needs and earn more money. The products she sells are of good quality and prices, and she provides good service. 

Currently María is being offered the chance to buy more scrap at a low price so she would earn a good profit on it. For this reason she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the scrap. She would use her earnings to buy more vegetables and staples for her store. María is confident that she will succeed in providing a steady income and a better life for her family who greatly deserve it.

loans.use:
Comprar chatarra, plásticos, cobre, verduras y productos de tienda
to buy scrap metal, plastic, copper, vegetables, and other items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, bags, creams, needles, buttons and electric irons.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has one child.

Vicenta has a general store business and a piggery too, and she earns approximately 10,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Vicenta has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Vicenta hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is a 47-year-old married man. He has 5 children ranging from 10 and 24 years. He describes himself  as polite, welcoming, and ambitious man. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are the local people. His business challenge is insufficient funds. He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to increase his stock of items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: To increase his stock of items

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед женат, имеет 4 детей. Он трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 7 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Он продает масло, сахар, конфеты, макароны, соки и т.д. А также он продает хозяйственные товары. Хуршед начал свой бизнес с малого оборота, а постепенно расширяя бизнес открыл еще один магазин. Теперь он хочет открыть другой магазин для продажи одежд с целью расширения бизнеса. С этой целью он запрашивает займ.
texts.en: Khurshed is married and has four children.  He is a hardworking and kind person.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products for over seven years.  Khurshed sells oil, sugar, candy, pasta, juice, etc., and also household goods.  He started his business with a small turnover and opened another store, while gradually growing his business.  And now he wants to open yet another store to sell clothing in order to expand his business.  This is why he is requesting the loan.

loans.use: to open another store and expand his business

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is divorced and lives with her father. She is a mother of two boys and one girl who are 9, 5 and 4 years old. 

She doesn’t want to become a burden on her parents; that’s why she manages the financial expenses of her children from her sewing business. She receives good orders from her neighboring clients and earns well after completing them on time.

Her father is a local entrepreneur and operates a business selling watches. He sells a variety of watches such as wall clocks, wristwatches, etc., to his customers. He sells them by visiting different areas and streets and attracts customers by announcing in a loud voice.

Asia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her father’s business. Her father will use the loan in buying watches of different varieties to increase his sales and profits.

Asia is very confident about her father’s business growth after the loan investment.

Note: One of the members sells artificial flowers; that is why they are holding flowers in the photo.

loans.use: To buy watches of different varieties for selling.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es: La nueva integrante del grupo es la señora Antonia va a comprar con su prestamo maiz, hojas para tamal, carne, azucar, piña, las otras integrantes siguen con su actividad que vienen desempeñando La señora Graciela tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el campo o de albañil, ellos tiene 2 hijos 1 niña y un niño los dos estudian en la primaria, ella vende zapatos y cosméticos por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar zapatos,  cosméticos y va a comprar unas laminas para el techo de la cocina, ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año le enseño una señora a vender los zapatos, ella tenía unos ahorros y los tomo para iniciar a surtir sus pedidos, ella sale a ofreces sus productos por las calles de su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la escuela de sus hijos, a ella le gusta su negocio porque se distrae, camina y hace amistades, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio de poder estar al pendiente de sus hijos  y con las ganancias le puede comprar a sus hijos algún juguete que les guste, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir es una oportunidad de ampliar su negocio va a comprar zapatos de dama, caballero y niño. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener su casa bien terminada, techarla y pintarla, que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Los integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos, ayudan a las personas a tener nuevas oportunidades,
texts.en:
The new member of the group is Antonia. With her loan she is going to buy corn, leaves for tamales, meat, sugar, and pineapples. The other members continue with the activities that they have been carrying out. 

Graciela is 33 years old. She is married. Her husband works in the field or as a construction worker. They have 2 children, a son and a daughter, and both of them are in primary school. She sells shoes and cosmetics by catalog. She is asking for a loan in order to buy shoes, cosmetics, and she is going to buy some steel sheets for the kitchen roof. 

She began her business a year ago. A women taught her to sell shoes. She had some savings and she used it to start fulfilling her orders. She goes about through the street of her community offering her goods. 

Her business is important because she has income in order to pay the school fees for her children. She likes the business because she enjoys it, walking and making friends. She is proud of having her own business in order to be able to be keep an eye out for her children and with the earnings she can buy her children some toy that they like. 

She is happy with the money she will receive from the loan as it gives her an opportunity to expand her business. She is going to buy shoes for ladies, men and children. Her dreams and hopes are to have a nicely finished house, roofing and painting, and that her children continue their studies. 

The members of the group give thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for their loans, helping people to have new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy shoes for ladies, men and children, perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old and married with one child.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Cristina has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Cristina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a father who is raising his family in a village. He is 46 and has three school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 28 years. He endures the hardships in farming because he wants to support his family and give them a better life. He aims to have a plentiful harvest to earn more income and support the education of his children.

Due to financial difficulties, he is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy agricultural supplies needed in corn farming, such as fertilizers and pesticides. He believes that this loan will enable him to expand his corn plantation and hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies needed in corn farming, such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Kunthea, 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker and her husband is a sculptor. In order to improve her family's income, Kuthea is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice. In the future, she would like to sell breakfast food at home to generate more income. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study at higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase a piece a farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Grupo Sector Mercado Group

texts.es:
Abraham (él primero del lado derecho) es un padre de familia muy trabajador y perseverante, tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida, él cuenta que se encuentra muy satisfecho con su préstamo pues le permitió brindarle mantenimiento a su molino de nixtamal, y con ello siguió mejorando sus ingresos económicos, con este avance él está contento pero no conforme por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo porque con el constante uso siempre es necesario darle mantenimiento a su molino de nixtamal, por esa razón confía plenamente que conseguirá el crédito. 
Su gran sueño es tener una cadena de molino para tener una estabilidad de vida mejor.

loans.use: Mantenimiento de molino de nixtamal.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. Agnes I. sells food provisions, a business she started 2 years ago. She is 39 years old. She emphasized the impact of LAPO loan in her business and hopes to expand her business with the above amount.

loans.use: Sale of food items

loans.name: Mlamua

texts.en:
Mlamua lives in Mbagala in Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He also takes care of his brother's three kids. His brother died last year in a car accident. He is self-employed and owns a small shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items, mainly food items, which have high demand, especially rice and maize flour. The shop provides him with an opportunity to raise his children.

He would like to expand his business so that he can meet costs of educating his children. The shop employs himself and his wife. To expand his business he needs a US$ 1000

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Monadjon

texts.en:
Monadjon has been engaged in his trade for 3 years.  She is married and has 3 sons.  She helps her elderly father and her sister’s family.  Her sister is divorced and has 2 children.  They all live together and are friendly.  They help Monadjon with her business.  Her father and children prepare seeds for processing.  Her sister works on the seed production equipment.  This processing gives the seeds a specific taste, which attract customers.  In 2005, Monadjon became a client of Micro Invest, and her first loan was $100.  She always repays her loans on time.  By the developing her business her loan needs have increased to $1000.

Today, Monadjon has a lot of clients; not only from Khujand, but also from other districts, such as Isfara, Kanibodom, and Nay. They purchase her seeds in packages of 10kg to 50kg.  In the future, she wishes to increase her volume production of seeds, and that’s why she wants to buy more equipment.

loans.use: Purchasing of equipment

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
"I am Sarwar B. and I live in Lahore. I have five children, three boys and two girls. I am 55 years old, all my children are married, and they live and work independently. I live alone, which is tough for women to do in Pakistan. I have to make my own living and travel to Peshawar about 7 hours from Lahore, my hometown. Peshawar is a conservative town where many women are not visible on the road but I like adventure. I purchase cloth and blankets in bulk at a lower rate and sell them door to door in my neighborhood at a higher rate. With the loan, I can purchase more items from Peshawar, sell in Lahore, and generate more profits."


Sarwar B., Lahore.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, blankets, etc., in bulk from Peshawar, a city in Pakistan known for its cheap prices.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vitoria works on her plantation daily while also being a full time mother. She is 21 years old and her determination to give her child a good education and good living conditions drives her to work hard to earn extra money. Her husband is a full time professional carpenter who does contract work that earns him a net of $200 a week. With the cost of living going up every day, it is very important for both of them to work. Therefore Vitoria tends and maintains her taro plantation so that her husband can sell two sacks every Saturday, which earns a profit of $120. She is now able to look after her family and make her loan repayments to SPBD, which allows her to take future loans.

loans.use: For home improvement and to expand her shop buy buying supplies and inventory

loans.name: Yusetty Ventura

texts.en:
Yusetty is a very congenial and positive 25-year-old woman.  She has three children and is pregnant.  For more than ten years, her husband and she have been running a general store.  Currently, she sells vegetables, ripe fruits, bread, milk, chocolate, rice, beans and other basic foodstuffs.  She would like to expand her inventory and include energy drinks, bath soap, toothpaste and other similar items after receiving her loan. 
The entrepreneur thinks that the business expansion will help her greatly and she will better help her husband support the family.

loans.use: To buy energy drinks, bath soap, toothpaste and other goods to introduce in her general store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucia lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres, San Martín. She devotes herself to selling food both out of her home and out of a small stand. She launched her business thanks to a friend who gave her the idea and invited her to the communal bank “El Tiempo Es Oro” (Time is Money). Thanks to a loan received through Manuela Ramos, she has been able to contribute to the household expenses, supporting her husband.

With this loan for $675, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy goods for the kitchen, including rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of oil, onions, dried potatoes, and other bulk goods so that she can serve her lodgers and guests that visit her day after day. Her husband, who dedicates himself to buying and selling wood in a business whose profits and responsibilities they share, will use the remainder of the loan. Currently, they own a small house that they were able to purchase thanks to the income generated by their businesses.

Mrs. Lucia is 36 years old, and has three children and a husband that she works with everyday to bring their children a solid education that will help them care for themselves later on. Among her plans are the improvement of her home and the expansion of her sales stand so she can bring her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lucia, vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica la venta D. comida, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en su casa en un pequeño local. Emprendió un negocio gracias a una amiga que le dio la idea y la invitó al Banco Comunal “el Tiempo es Oro” y gracias al préstamo recibido por Manuela Ramos ha podido contribuir y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Con el préstamo D. S/.2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará artículos para la cocina como arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en cajas, cebolla, papa sacos y otros en cantidades grandes para atender a sus pensionistas y comensales que la visitan día a día, otra parte del préstamo lo trabajará su esposo quien se dedica a la compra y venta D. madera, negocio en la que juntos comparten las ganancias y responsabilidades. Actualmente ya tienen una casita el cual han podido comprar gracias a los ingresos que les generan los negocios D. ambos.

La señora Lucía tiene 36 años, tres hijos y un esposo con quien trabaja día a día para brindarle a sus hijos una educación sólida y que les permita defenderse más adelante. Dentro D. sus planes está el acondicionar mejor su casa y ampliar su local D. venta D. comida para así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for cooking - rice, sugar, oil, onion, etc. Purchase of wood for second business.

loans.name: Angelica Adelaida

texts.es:
Angelica Perez is 32 years old. She is a single mother and has a 6 years old boy. She lives in the reparto neighborhood of Managua, which has one of the highest delinquency rates of the City. She is an Elementary teacher in the school district.

Her house is built with wood pieces and zinc,. She is asking for a loan to built a concrete house. She wants to buy the construction materials and begin to built a safer house for her and her child. Although she lives in very humble conditions, Angelica is very entrepreneur and her dream is to be able to see a finished house.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica P. tiene 32 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene un niño de 6 años. Habita en el barrio reparto Shick de Managua, uno de los barrios con más índice delincuencial de la Ciudad. Es maestra de educación primaria en el colegio del barrio. Actualmente su casa está hecha de tablas y zinc, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para empezar a hacer su casa de concreto, quiere comprar materiales de construcción para empezar a levantar su vivienda, y así poder sentirse más segura ella junto a su niño. Aunque habita en condiciones muy humildes, Angélica es muy emprendedora y su sueño es poder ver su casa terminada.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Joka

texts.en: Joka was born in 1941 and lives in the village of Laktaši with her husband, who is retired. His pension is 150 KM per month. They receive aid from abroad that amounts to an additional 500 KM per month. She intends to use this loan for 1,000 KM to buy livestock. Working with her husband, she will produce milk products and reduce their need to buy them somewhere else.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Reydelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Reydelinda C. C. is a member of the Community Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in the street Alfonso Ugarte in a stall in the Las Brisas de Huallaga market. She sells fruit grown locally, which is purchased daily by the city's inhabitants.

Thanks to the support of her husband and daughters, and to her own effort , she has succeeded in growing her business and has won a warm welcome and the esteem of a large clientele.

With this loan of 2000 solos (Peruvian currency) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy diverse fruits from the region such as oranges, bunches of bananas and guineos (fruit similar to bananas), sacks of fresh and dried coconut, crates of papaya and large quantities of exotic local fruits such as taperuvas, coconas and shica shica in order to stock her market stall and satisfy her clients’ demands.

Miriam is 60 years old. She works daily, showing herself to be an enterprising woman for whom, when it comes to meeting her goals, there are no limits. She rises to the occasion to meet her goals with effort and dedication. She is making plans to one day have her own grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Reydelinda C. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, en un puesto del mercado “Las Brisas del Huallaga”, se dedica a la venta de frutas propias de la zona, que diariamente es comprado por los moradores de la ciudad.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijas y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida de una gran clientela.

Con el crédito de S/.2,000.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas frutas de la región como: naranjas, taperivas, coconas en cientos, shica shica en kilos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, cocos fresco y seco en sacos , papayas en jabas para así tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes.

La señora Miriam tiene 60 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Wary's Nkura Group

texts.en:
Wary is 39 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 16 years old. Wary is a food seller, and she started in 1999. Every day, she works from 6 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items (rice, meat, tomatoes and maize flour) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth K. and Elizabeth Y., who have businesses dealing in fruit sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice, meat, tomatoes and maize flour) for her business

loans.name: Faaotaota

texts.en: Faaotaota P., 42, is married and has eight children. For more than two years, she has made a living selling cooked banana chips to school children, residents of her village and the public. She does this six days a week. In the past, she took out one loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $250.  SPBD loans are Faaotaota’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with a traditional bank. Part of her loan will be used to expand and repair her house. Her husband is employed at a nearby company, Funway Rental.

loans.use: Purchase a bundle of bananas, a gallon of oil, a pan for deep frying, a gas cooker and plastic bags.

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es:
Doña Kelita is a 48 year-old single mother of 7 children, who are independent with their own families, and daily she makes a effort to feel useful and to support her beloved daughter who is a single mother and her young granddaughter. For a living she sells fruit and candy and her main clients are employees of a state health center. Due to the demand of her products and her constant effort, she has decided to improve her work space and she is awaiting the response from your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Kelita D. 48 años D. edad es madre soltera y tiene 07 hijos los cuales ya se independizaron y poseen sus propias familias, se esfuerza a diario para sentirse útil y para apoyar a su amada hija, que es madre soltera, con su pequeña nieta. Se dedica a la venta D. frutas y dulces y sus principales clientes son los funcionarios D. un centro D. salud estatal. Debido a la demanda D. sus productos y a su esfuerzo constante ha decidido mejorar su espacio D. labor y se encuentra en espera D. la respuesta D. tu bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Increase capital to enlarge and improve work space.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang B., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Mob, 43, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have five children, four sons and one daughter. The first son does construction work with his father, and two other children are in local school.

Mr. Samnang has been a mason for sixteen years. He does his work in the village and nearby province while his wife stays at home taking care of their children. The couple is in the process of building their new house and they need a loan to finish it.

Samnang is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to make a stair rail and wall of the house and fill in the ground.

loans.use: To build a stair rail and wall of their house and fill in the ground

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two daughters and a son. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she sells leather goods in the central city market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, Irina has about $2000 in inventory. Her net profit amounts to $600 a month.

Irina has been using Nadiya Ukraine's lending services for about 7 years. This time she is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to purchase additional merchandise, increase her assortment of inventory, and generate additional income. We believe her ability to run the financial end of the enterprise and handle stress well will secure prompt loan repayment and consistent development of Irina’s enterprise.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She owns a small business in the town of Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. It is a small store selling clothing items. There's no high competition in the area where she works. The favorable location coupled with financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine have been the factors that impacted growth of her business.

Oksana likes to work in the sphere of trade. She has been working in it for three years during which she faced different challenges such as shaky sale trends, bad timing and other vagaries that can afflict a startup. A combination of core commercial skills, creative enthusiasm and determination to succeed have been her motivating factors.

Oksana would like to get a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1,075) which she believes would help her not only sustain her business but also promote its significant growth.

loans.use: To increase range of inventory in her clothing store.

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha has been selling food products in Zanzibar since 2006. Two of her staple products are chilli peppers (known as "pilipili" in Swahili) and maize (known as "bisi" in Swahili). Both are used frequently for cooking in Tanzania. Asha works every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $20 from the sale of her food ingredients.

Asha will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kaye A.. Kaye also owns a shop in Zanzibar. Both women are hoping that this loan will allow them to increase the profits they earn at their respective shops.

loans.use: To buy more food products for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Aida D. é natural da cidade do Maputo e tem 38 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos e abandonada pelo pai dos filhos, dado que em 2004 saiu de casa indo a africa do sul em busca de emprego e nunca voltou. Para alem dos seus quatros filhos sustenta também 3 sobrinhos que os pais perderam a vida vítimas do HIV mora com eles.

Aida estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, em 2005 mudei me da cidade de Maputo para Ponta em busca de melhores condições, lá vendia vários produtos mas éramos muitos de mais e decide vir cá na ponta quando soube dos preços na companhia da minha prima que morava cá a muito tempo e até agora vivo na casa dela.

Aida é vendedeira no mercado da ponta tendo um pequeno estabelecimento no mercado onde vende mais tomates cebolas adquirindo-os na  africa do sul e vai três vezes por semana, aprendeu esta actividade desde pequena antes de ir ao lar já vendia peixes fritos. Tem um rendimento diário de 800,00mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo para Aida e nunca solicitou noutras instituições, e conheceu a hluvuku-adsema  através de amigas que já eram  clientes. Assim tem como grande sonho aquisição do um talhão para construção da sua própria casa..
texts.en:
Aida D. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 38 years old and mother of 4 children. She was abandoned by her husband who went to South Africa in 2004 to look for work, and never returned. Besides supporting her 4 children, she also supports and houses 3 nieces and nephews who lost their parent as victims to HIV. Aida studied until the 5th grade, and then had to stop due to lack of finances. In 2005 she moved from the city of Maputo to Ponta, looking for better conditions. In Maputo she sold many products, but the family was too big. She decided to go to Ponta when she heard of the prices in her sister’s company, who had lived there for many years. Aida now lives at her sister’s house. Aida is a vendor at the Ponta market. She has a small establishment where she sells mostly tomatoes and onions, purchased in South Africa, three times a week. Aida has been doing this kind of activity since she was a child, when she sold fried fish. Aida earns about 800,00 MT a day. This is Aida’s second loan, although she has never requested one through another institution. She discovered Hluvuku-Adsema through friends who were already clients. Her greatest dream is to acquire a piece of land on which to build her own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling basic goods

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin makes phone calls, sells rechargeable phone cards and sells dried fish. She says makes more profits from the sales of dried fish. The demands for her dried fish during this festive holiday season are high, and she hopes to make more profits from her sales. She needs the loan to purchase more dried fish to sell. Toyin is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señorita Elida es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” de la provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 1 hija. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró productos de belleza. Tiene casi 5 años  trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que cambió de rubro, ahora vende celulares.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,100 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará celulares para su negocio
Elida desea continuar trabajando para tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Miss Elida is a partner of Banco Comunal "Flores la Pampilla" of the province of Puno in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single and the mother of 1 daughter. With her first loan of S/.300 she bought beauty products. She has been working with the bank for almost 5 years. She tells us that at the moment she is selling mobile phones. With this loan of S/.1,100, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will purchase mobile phones for her business. Elida wishes to continue working in order to get her own premises.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. sells provisions and drinks. She is married and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохид мужчина 46 лет, женат имеет четверых детей.Сам работает завхозом в школе.Его зарплата не хватает для проживания его семь, поэтому он имеет свой семейный бизнес.Ему по бизнесу помогает его сын,который на фото,сам Вохид вовремя мониторинга был в отъезде за товаром.Вохида не возможно застать на месте деятельности ,т.к. он всегда занят по работе и по завозу товара.Его сын взрослый молодой человек и очень ответственный,отец ему полностью доверяет бизнес в его отсутствии.Кредит хочет получитьдля увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Vohid is a 46 year old man who is married and has four children. He is an office manager in a school. His salary is too small to support his family, so he started a family business. His son (pictured in the photograph as Vohid was away transporting goods during the monitoring session) helps with the business. Vohid can never be found on site since he is always busy with work and moving goods. His son is a mature young man and very responsible, whom his father completely entrusts the business to in his absence. A loan is requested for expanding inventory selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Toiletry retail

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús G. V. tiene un cuarto que aun no habita por que le faltan algunos detalles los cuales para el son primordiales para que se vea bien y presentable al momento de poner muebles. El quiere comprar vitropiso y pagar mano de obra. 
El ha sido buen cliente ya ha tenido crédito el cual pago muy bien el percibe ingresos de una tiende de abarrotes y trabaja como supervisor en una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Jesús G. V. has a room that he still has not moved it to it because it lacks some details that are essential to him. He needs the room to look good and presentable when he moves the furniture into it. He wants to buy vinyl flooring and also pay for labor to install the flooring. He has been a good customer and has already received loans which he repaid in a timely manner. He receives income from a mini market that he owns and he also works as a supervisor in a factory.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vinyl flooring and also pay for labor to install it

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El señor Lino C. vive en casa alquilada, en la zona  las Delicias, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Elizabeth Valdez.
El señor Lino trabaja como Gastrónomo, atendiendo reuniones sociales particulares y su esposa es ama de casa.
Con sus ahorros, el señor Lino realizó la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad de El Alto, al oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
 El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones nuevas en su propiedad.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Lino C. lives in a rented house in the zone of "las Delicias" ["the Delights"], a hill north of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Elizabeth Valdez. Lino works as a food critic, attending in particular social gatherings. His wife is a housewife. With his savings, Lino was able to buy a plot of land in the city of El Alto, a city to the west of La Paz. The loan that Lino is requesting is for the contruction of two new rooms on his property. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis that was performed favorably qualified him so that he can access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two new rooms on his property

loans.name: Ahmirza

texts.ru: Ахмирза - мужчина 45 лет. Женат и отец 6 детей. Образование у него среднее. У сельских жителей почти нет возможности учится в Университетах. Только состоятельные единицы, у которых есть возможность арендовать квартиру в городе, могут учится. Но для этого требуется много денег. У Ахмирзы пока нет возможности обучать своих детей. Но он старается работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы появить такую возможность. За этим он обратился в нашу организацию, чтобы мы помогли ему. За этот кредит он хочет купить овец, и до августа месяца, откормив их продать подороже.
texts.en:
Ahmirza is a 45 year old man. He is married and is the father of 6 children. He has a high school education. Rural residents have almost no ability to study at the university. Only wealthy individuals who have the ability to rent an apartment in the city can study. But this requires a lot of money. Ahmirza does not have the ability to educate his children right now. But he tries to work and earn more money so that this ability will appear. He has turned to our organization so that we can help him. He would like to use this loan to purchase sheep and fatten them until the month of August when he will sell them for a higher price.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. O. is a 40-year-old mother of seven children, ages 13-27. She is selling cloth used for clothing and bags that she purchases in Nairobi. If she can't afford to get them in Nairobi, she will purchase them from wholesalers at Kibuye, Kisumu's largest open air market. She says on average, she can make about 20,000 KSH a month, depending on how many customers come. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to buy more materials for her business and to pay school fees for the children.

Joyce recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata T. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier  Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Secrétaire de Direction de formation, c’est après son mariage qu’elle s’est investie véritablement dans le commerce notamment celui de l’encens et d’habits. Elle jouit d’une très grande réputation aujourd’hui surtout en ces périodes de mariages, auprès des femmes de Ségou. 
 Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est  en relation  depuis 42 mois. Après  2 prêts individuels et 3 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, une pièce de bazin riche, deux pièces de bazin moins riche, dix pièces de pagnes wax « hytterget ». Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes au grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Madame Aminata T.  vend en détail au comptant et à crédit chez elle à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, supporter certaines dépenses familiales et  rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata T., age 42, is married and the mother of three. She lives with her husband and children in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A personal secretary by training, she essentially invested herself, upon marrying, into commercial business, notably in incense and clothing. She enjoys an enormous reputation today, especially during the marriage season, among women in Ségou. With the goal of augmenting her working capital, in order to satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 42 months. After two individual loans and three solidarity loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. This new loan will be used to buy a bolt of rich damask fabric, two bolts of less-rich damask, and ten bolts of Hitarget pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Supplies are gotten from wholesalers at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali). Sales are made at the retail level out of her home, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings, covering certain expenses, and repaying the loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin and her husband Ronnie T. live happily in Barangay Baresbes Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Both of them graduated from college but, unfortunately, were not able to find well paying jobs. The couple still wants to give their children a good education, though, and are working so hard for their future.

Ronnie works as a security guard in Solano while Mylin manages a food and snack vending business in their house. She is asking to borrow PHP 5,000 as working capital to maintain and expand her business. Her average net income weekly is PHP 750.

Mylin sacrifices much to make her business work. She must wake up early in the morning to prepare food to sell as people go to work. She hopes to have a fruitful business that will enable her to help her husband to uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.en:
Djumagul lives with her husband and her three children. She is a tailor who offers her great services to her neighbors. Her earnings are used to help cover her household expenses. Her work and her financial contribution have enhanced her self-esteem and her self-confidence. Djumagul is very proud of her work. This is the third time that Djumagul has requested a loan from IMON International, a Kiva partner. Having said this, Djumagul has an excellent history of on-time repayment. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Gulzhan's Group

texts.en: Married and the mother of five children, Gulzhan is the leader of the group. She has five children: four daughters and one son. Even though one of her daughters is married and her son has gone to Moscow to work, after having reached the age of forty-seven, she still has to look after her other three daughters, the smallest of whom is just four years old. For the sake of that she is engaged in stock-raising. Mainly, Gulzhan purchases calves and feeds and resells them. Her husband helps her after work. She started this business twenty-five years ago with just eight dollars. Now her monthly income is 150 dollars! “Cattle-breeding is not the most profitable business. It is not sitting in a clean office gazing into a monitor, doing accounts. Anyway by raising cattle, we’ve been able to buy a house, furniture, home equipment and even pay for the marriage of our eldest daughter,” says Gulzhan proudly. Currently, Gulzhan needs a loan to increase her livestock population, fatten it up and resell it. In the near future she is going to have a new shed built and a hay-loft, as well as finishing the building of her house, buy her son a car and pay for another daughter’s wedding. Gulzhan has four partners: Nurzada, Baktijar, Dilbar and Dzhanatkul. Dzhanatkul works as a cook at a school lunch room. The rest are occupied with cattle-breeding. All the members need loans mainly to purchase more livestock, so that they can resell it later. Nurzada inherited four sheep and one cow. Now she has ten sheep and two cows. She wants a shed to store fodder, after buying a car to get married. Baktijar started with buying sheep. Then he bought horned cattle. For the moment he has sheep, oxen and a horse. Dilbar and her husband used to save money to buy cattle. Now theу have a cow, a calf and sheep. She wants to buy a car and pay for her son’s marriage. Years ago Dzhanatkul bought a cow which provided seven liters of milk a day. Now she has three cows and gets twenty liters a day. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa  Somarraba tiene la edad de 47 años, reside en el barrio  Rene Cisnero en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos que estudian, sus planes es mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace quince año logro poner con los ahorros y ayuda de su esposo y con las ganancias de la venta de refrescos y golosinas. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos y eskimo ya que tiene un freezer de venta de eskimo el cual se vende mucho por su rico sabor. Su objetivo es poder crecer en ventas para obtener mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con el prestamos adquirido ya que podrá fortalecer su negocio y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa Somarraba is 47 years old and lives in the Rene Cisnero neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school. She plans to improve her family's living conditions. Josefa runs a small grocery store, which she was able open 15 years ago thanks to her savings, her husband's help, and the money she earned selling drinks and sweets. She will use this loan to buy basic grains and Eskimo brand ice cream for her freezer. She sells a lot of this ice cream, thanks to its delicious flavor. Her goal is to sell more so that she can earn more in profits. She would like to thank the institution, because previous loans have allowed her to strengthen her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and Eskimo ice cream

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is amember of the itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 12,15,18, and 20 years.

Eva started her own shop business selling rice,salts,cooking oil 1 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eva first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities like rice etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Eva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Don Bonifacio M. tiene la edad de 54 años en los que desde joven ha estado trabajando en la venta de lotería convencional y con la ayuda de su esposa logro establecer un pequeño negocio de una pulpería en su vivienda. Para esto es importante señalar que Fundación León 2000 ha sido su mano amiga en varias ocasiones concediéndole créditos para llegar a establece este negocio. Para seguir fortaleciendo la pulpería que tiene en su hogar se Bonifacio precisa de un financiamiento y de esta manera invertir en el comprando materia como es aceite, arroz, frijoles, pan, detergentes, jabón, consomé, y otros productos que necesita tener de venta. Es por eso que el solicita a esta institución un financiamiento con el cual ya esta contando para lograr las metas que se propuso para este año.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jeanne's Group

texts.fr: D. Jeanne est née le 01/01/1958 à Grand-Popo. Jeanne est mariée à SOUKOU Martin, un tailleur. Ce couple a à sa charge six enfants dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Jeanne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Jeanne vend de façon ambulante des tissus. Mais, Jeanne vend aussi du SODABI, une boisson alcoolisée produit au Bénin. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Jeanne achète ses produits. Jeanne a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Jeanne a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Jeanne demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
D. Jeanne was born on January 1, 1958 in Grand-Popo. She is married to SOUKOU Martin, a tailor. This couple has six children to support. Four of them are their own. For 22 years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Thanks to the income from her business, Jeanne comes to her husband’s aid in covering family expenses. She sells cloth door-to-door. But she also sells SODABI, an alcoholic drink produced in Benin. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Jeanne buys her products. Jeanne already has ten years of experience in this business. She had two loans with ALIDé that she has repaid. She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business. To continue to develop it, she’s asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and drums of the drink SODABI

loans.name: Klizisto's Group

texts.en: N. Klizisto is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard working and responsible man with a wife and 7 children all in school although 3 of them are soon completing and in higher institutions of learning. He also helps to take care of other orphans and dependants belonging to his late siblings. Klizisto is a business man involved in fishing whereby he sells most of the fish that that he catches from Terere landing site as well as selling to his retail customers using his bicycle to move the fish around to his customers. Fishing is his first job ever since he was a teenager and he is happy that it is paying. He has been able to educate his children as well as acquiring tangible property out of it plus with the help of loans. He has his own boats that he uses to fish and as he saves, he needs to buy another boat for expansion. He needs a loan to help buy more fishing materials like fishing nets, hooks, and jecks for improved service.

loans.use: Buying more fishing materials like hooks, fishing nets and jecks for improved services.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Mr. Sin S. is a farmer with a 1 acre field in which he grows rice. His fields are now infertile, and he cannot grow any more rice. He is taking out this loan so he will be able to purchase fertilizer to be able to grow rice on his only field. He has a wife who is fifty years and two children, one a monk and one who is in school. His wife sells cakes, candy and other food in the local school where their son attends. They live in the Damnak village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary L., 49 and her husband, Mr. Mat Sos, 50, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. The daughters are married and live in separate homes, two sons are fishermen and two sons are in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mary sells fish that her husband catches at the village market. Some of her husband’s fishing nets are broken, so she is requesting a loan of $600 to help purchase new fishing nets, so he will able to continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en: This committee was formed in Caaguazú, when Emerita Quiñonez invited a group of women to come together when she learned about the Women’s Entrepreneurship program. She gathered 17 women, all of whom were enthusiastic about working together to take out a loan to improve their businesses. All of the women already had jobs, as venders of clothing, shoes, jewelry, fruits and vegetables. They decided to use their loan to invest further in their businesses, and received between PYG1,200,000 and PYG300,000 each depending on the size of their business. They used their loans to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, cheese, candy, and clothing, including jeans, shirts, skirts, lingerie. They share a common goal to improve their businesses and their lives, for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin sells frozen foods at retail prices to her customers. She has 2 deep freezers that she uses to store her frozen foods. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for 6 years. The demand for her frozen foods is high. She hopes to own a poultry farm in the future.

Toyin is 44 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Nereyda Yanetza

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Nereyda S. posee su propia pulpería la que está surtida con granos básicos, verduras, ropa y productos refrigerados como carne, pollo y embutidos que son vendidos a sus clientes de la cuadra y del barrio donde habita. 

Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y a pesar que es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener, ha logrado brindarle las condiciones necesarias de vida para que este niño se desarrolle. 

El crédito que ella está solicitando es para la compra de los productos para la pulpería, entre los productos que ella comprará se encuentran granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jamón, huevos, carne de res y de pollo. Espera ser beneficiada con este crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the city of Nagarote, Mrs. Nereyda Sanchez owns a grocery store supplied with grains, vegetables, clothing and chilled products such as meet, chicken and sausages. She sells these products to clients from her block and neighborhood.

She stood out for being a hard worker. Even though she is a single mother with a son to support, she has managed to provide him with the necessary life conditions he needs to develop.

The loan she is requesting is to buy products for her store, among them basic grains like rice, sugar, olive oil, ham, eggs, pork and chicken meet. She hopes to get this loan to improve her life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: V. is forty-eight years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province, where she has established a small family home and earns a living as a local farmer. She was married, but has divorced her husband, and she has two teenage children. One of her daughters sews clothes in the local garment factory and has provided her little income to feed her family. V. needs a loan to repair the often-broken roof of her old house.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her old house

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: A. Solange est née en 1968 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Il y a 11 ans environs que Solange s’est installée à Djeffa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à VODOUNNOU Josué, un policier, Solange est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Solange vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Djeffa. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Solange n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs sept ans, Solange vend divers produits (farine de manioc, sucre, huile végétale, biscuits, lait, sardine, eau de javel, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Solange s’approvisionne. Solange a bénéficié antérieurement de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Malgré la passion que Solange a pour son activité, elle ne dispose pas d'assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, Solange sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges, et d’autre part pour se faire une épargne consistante.
texts.en:
A. Solange was born in 1968 in Parakou, in northern Benin. About eleven years ago, she got situated in Djeffa, in the community of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. Married to VODOUNNOU Josué, a police officer, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her children and husband in Djeffa. The couple jointly ensures that house expenses are covered. Solange never attended school. For seven years, she has been selling a variety of goods (cassava flour, sugar, vegetable oil, cookies, milk, sardines, bleach, etc.) out of her home. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up. She has benefited from three ALIDé loans before, which she repaid. Despite the passion she has for her work, she doesn't have enough funds for carrying out her work and for earning more revenues from it to meet her responsibilities.
