texts.es: Santos M. esta soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, solo curso estudios hasta el nivel primario, desde muy pequeño ayuda a sus padre quienes se dedican al engorde de ganado vacuno para su comercialización, de donde fue ganando experiencia en la actividad y llegando a hacer pequeñas inversiones que a la fecha le permiten tener 4 cabezas de ganado de su propiedad, es muy notoria las ganas e ímpetu que tiene para crecer económicamente, es para ello que pide el crédito, incrementar su hato y de esta forma ayudar a sus padre, independientemente además el muestra muchas ganas para continuar sus estudio y capacitarse en el cuidado y engorde de ganado.
texts.en:
Santos M. is single, is 21 years old, and attended only primary school. Since he was a little boy, he's helped his father with the business of fattening cows to then sell. Santos has gained experience in this activity, making small investments that now allow him to keep four cows in his property. Santos' drive to grow the business is obvious. He is asking for a loan to increase the number of cows he keeps in order help his father. Santos would also like to continue studying and become better at fattening cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies (flour, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Afgan

texts.en:
Afgan is 30 years old and from the Fuzuli region. He is married and has two children, ages 10 and 15. For the past six years, Afgan has been raising sheep. His 15-year-old son helps him, while his wife shears the sheep for wool from which she makes warm jackets and blankets that the family sells. 

Afgan is seeking a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy five more sheep, hoping to sell more meat, milk, yogurt and cheese in time for Ramadan this year. This would be his first loan.

loans.use: To buy 5 more sheep

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Namagainda Faridah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.  Faridah has a grocery business in Kinoni, where she sells food and produce such as sugar, tomatoes, and onions.  She has had her business for over one year.  Faridah’s business serves the local community by providing a good selection of food to the people in her village.

To expand her business, Faridah is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for buying more stock of goods to sell in her grocery.  Faridah hopes to expand her grocery business and sell more types of goods, in order to gain more profit and support her young family.


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Additional food items for grocery

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita D. is from the village of New Tambo, Katipunan. She is 57 years old and single. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Roselily

texts.en:
Roselily D. is from the village of Manaoag. She is 43 years old. Roselily is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roselily owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roselily has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Roselily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 from ASKI. Roselily is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Roselily from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Susan Wanjiru

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and has two children in secondary school. She is married to John Muturi who operates a taxi within Nairobi city centre. She has been running her business for about six years and has an income of about KES 80,000.

She wants to use the loan to buy more inventory for her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to renovate the rental houses she has. Her dream is to have a stable income, through which she can meet all of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To increase inventory of products like beans, rice, and mung beans

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, is married, and is responsible for his family.

He rented a place to open his own business as a salesperson, selling women's clothes and accessories, plus home supplies. He has run his shop for more than three years and he likes his job because, in his opinion, it's a profitable and continuous business since his products are necessities. He is well-known and respectable in his local community.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI. He wants to invest it in buying new products and renovating his shop.

loans.use: To buy new products and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Sitoi Ole

texts.en:
Sitoi Ole K. is 45 years old. He is married to Sialo K. and he is the father of three children. Sitoi is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land as he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET LTD. This will be his second loan and he is planning to spend thirty thousand to buy chemicals to spray his already growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Sitoi's dream is do large-scale farming, attain financial independence, and improve the living standard of his family. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray his already growing wheat

loans.name: Fuente De Sabiduría Group

texts.es: Doña Silvia  Patricia H. L., es una persona casada,  se dedica a la astesanía "Elaboración de canastas de plastico", con el onjeto de ampliar su capital de trabajo decide solicitar un prestamos grupal, dicho grupo  esta conformado por cinco integrantes, tienen visión de superación, desde hace muchos años vienen ejerciendo  una actividad económica; especialmente se dedican a la Artesanía “Elaboración de canastillas plásticas”  en donde utilizan materiales de larga duración como; hilos de plásticos, cinta de plásticos todo esto en beneficio de quienes lo adquieren para no comprar bolsas  plásticas a poco tiempo, y al mismo tiempo  contribuir al medio ambiente, a no deteriorar mas nuestro planeta, los otros integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales como: pollos, cerdos, otros se dedican a la agricultura, siembra de semillas maíz y frijol. Por  esta razón solicitan a la Asociación de Desarrollo Integral Rural (ASDIR) Un préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, su producción y su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia Patricia H. L. is a married woman.  She is an artisan who concentrates on making plastic baskets.  With the goal of increasing her working capital, she decided to request a group loan.  Her group [the "Fuente de Sabiduría, or "Fountain of Wisdom" Group] is made up of five members who are looking to succeed.  All of them have been working for many years.  In particular, some work as artisans making plastic baskets, for which they use long-lasting materials like plastic thread and plastic tape.  This benefits those who buy the baskets because they do not have to buy plastic bags all the time, and at the same time it contributes to the environment by not further deteriorating our planet.

The other members of this group work raising animals like chickens and pigs.  Others work in agriculture, planting corn and beans.  In order to increase their working capital and improve their quality of life, they are requesting a loan from the Integral Rural Development Association (ASDIR).

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María E. de B. de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y junto a tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales gracias a muchos esfuerzos se dedican a estudiar. Rosa reside junto a su familia en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Ella trabaja en su propio negocio en el que comercializa dulces típicos como: conservas las cuales son hechas de coco, dulces de leche, jalea de manzanas, dulces de nance, coco rallado y otros más, los cuales comercializa en el pueblo de Ilobasco, el cual es un lugar muy turístico, por lo que es muy apropiado para este tipo de ventas, ya que tanto personas del país como extranjeros disfrutan de estos dulces. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar diferentes tipos de frutas para la elaboración de estos dulces, los cuales posteriormente pueda vender en mayores cantidades. de esta forma Rosa espera obtener más ganancias y vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: Rosa María E. D. B., 39, lives with her husband and their 3 minor children, who, thanks to a lot of effort, are all in school.  Rosa lives with her family in Sensuntepeque in the Cuscatlán department.  She has her own business where she sells sweets that are typical of El Salvador such as coconut sweets, milk caramel, apple jam, nance sweets, grated coconut, and other products, which she sells in the town of Ilobasco, a town that has a lot of tourism.  For this reason it is a very suitable place to sell these products, since so many people from the country and also from abroad enjoy these sweets.  Rosa requests a loan to buy different types of fruit to make these sweets, which she will later sell in large quantities.  In this way, Rosa hopes to obtain better earnings and live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make traditional Salvadoran sweets

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, the province of Collao, and the department of Puno. She is 28 years old, married, and has four children. She completed her secondary education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of products for the preparation of quinoa juice (quinoa is a grain-like crop that comes from the region). Celia has two business activities: the sale of bread in the afternoon and the sale of quinoa juice in the morning. She is currently asking for a loan for 2,400 PEN, which she will use to buy the ingredients she needs to maintain operations of her business. Her dream is to buy a bus and start a business transporting people on the route between Desaguadero and Ilave. 

Her favorite part about working with the Communal Bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: To purchase consumables for her business selling food and quinoa

loans.name: Yudel Ondina

texts.es:
Yudel  es una mujer de muy poco recursos económicos, tiene 37años de edad, madre de dos hijos,  vive junto a su esposo el cual se desempeña de albañil, por cuenta propia.
Yudel trabaja en servicios domestico, desde hace varios años el cual inicio por ayudar a su familia, su casa es de zinc, pero propia el cual no ha podido hacer mejora por qué no se ajusta.
Hoy en día está haciendo un financiamiento para lograr comenzar  a construir su casa de concreto, lo que está contenta con este comienzo que Afodenic está dando por medio de préstamos a plazos. Como planes es terminar de hacer  su casa que es su anhelo para una mejor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yudel, 37, is a woman of very limited economic resources.  She is the mother of two children.  She lives with her husband who works independently as a bricklayer.

Yudel has worked as a domestic employee for several years, work she started in order to help her family.  Her house is made of zinc metal sheeting and, although it’s her own, she hasn’t been able to make improvements to it because her income isn’t enough.

She is negotiating a loan to start to build her house out of concrete.  She is happy with this beginning that Afodenic has made possible through loans payable in installments.  Her plan for the future is to finish building her house to provide better security for her children.

loans.use: She will buy building materials and supplies to start to build her dwelling out of concrete which she will do gradually with these loans due to her economic situation.

loans.name: Nkaate

texts.en:
Nkaate O. is 32 years old. He is married to Napilosh Kasale and he is a father of two school-going children, aged 5 and 18. Nkaate has been a tomato farmer for the last five years.
  
Nkaate learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his third loan. He is planning to spend 35,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for his tomato farming and with the other Kshs 15,000, he will buy some sheep for fattening to later sell at a profit. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of tomatoes.

Nkaate hopes to become a large-scale farmer, both in tomato farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and chemicals for tomato farming and to buy some sheep for fattening to sell later

loans.name: Rommel Hernán

texts.es:
Rommel Hernán G. Q. tiene 33 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con el hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Rommel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro y remodelar la casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Rommel Hernán G. Q. is 33 years old.  He is married, and lives with his wife and child.  He lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar province.  He has one son.

The members of the rural communal bank "Yagui Grande" live 30 minutes from the San Miguel office, in the canton of San Miguel.  The members of this communal bank are farmers who do short cycle cultivation of corn and potatoes.  They have a lot of experience in this line of work.

Rommel is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel, and sells his crops in the San Miguel market on Thursdays.

He requests a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for his corn and potato crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to get the supplies he needs.  Farmers in this area face challenges such as pests and diseases and climatic changes.  His dream is to buy a car and renovate his house.

He enjoys sports and spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Lydia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lydia del Carmen C. D. M. D. 67 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a un hijo mayor D. edad quien es soltero, el cual le ayuda con el negocio. DesD. hace 26 años atrás que Lydia trabaja vendiendo golosinas como: dulces, galletas, chocolates, tostadas, y otros más, el negocio esta ubicado frente a su casa D. habitación la cual esta sobre la calle principal lo que es muy bueno para el negocio D. Lydia ya que se encuentra a la vista D. muchas personas. Lydia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. manera que su inventario crezca, y así pueda ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Esta venta D. golosinas es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuenta Lydia por lo que una D. sus mayores prioridades es mejorar las condiciones D. este.
texts.en:
Lydia del Carmen C. D. M. is 67 years old.  She lives in Mejicanos, in San Salvador department together with a grown-up son who is single and helps her in her business.

26 years ago, Lydia started selling sweet treats such as: candy, cookies, chocolate, popcorn, etc.  Her business is located in front of her home which is on a main street.  This is very good for Lydia's business since it is visible to a lot of people.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of products so that she can increase her inventory and thereby offer more products to her customers.  This business is the only source of income Lydia has, so one of her main priorities is improving it.

loans.use: To buy sweet treats to sell

loans.name: María Gertrudis

texts.es: María Gertrudis B. de 46 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive sola debido a que sus hijos y están casados. María se esfuerza día con día para poder contar con el sustento diario, es por ellos que se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, cosméticos, cremas para el rostro y el cabello, entre otros más. Su venta la realiza de forma ambulante por diferentes sectores de San Juan Opico, en donde cuenta con una ruta establecida con clientes frecuentes. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos y productos para el cuidado de la piel, así de esta forma poder vender productos de diferentes precios, de manera que pueda abarcar un mayor mercado.
texts.en:
María Gertrudis B. is 46 years old and lives alone in San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad.  Her children are all married.  Maria works hard to make a daily living by selling perfume, body creams, cosmetics, face cream and hair products, among others.  She conducts door-to-door sales in the different areas of San Juan Opico where she has an established route and frequent customers.

María plans to use the loan to buy more cosmetics and skincare products, so she can offer an extensive price range and increase her market share.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and skincare products for retail sales

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.en:
Abdumavlon B. is a 39-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. Abdumavlon raises and sells cattle. He has 10 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Abdumavlon has become a very successful businessman. 

Abdumavlon has a friendly family whose members always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with his business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding them and pasturing them. 

Now Abdumavlon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He has applied for a loan of 5,000 TJS. Abdumavlon thanks all lenders for their support.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos S. is a 30-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids, both of whom are attending the public high school. Her husband, Chan Sarom, is 29 and works as a worker at the garment industry, and has a regular salary of about $4 a day. Ruos S.’s husband complains that it is hard to travel to work because he doesn’t have a vehicle. He goes to work by taxi or he walks. 

Ruos S. is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

Note: Ruos S. and her youngest child are in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from the village of ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old. Arlene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general services to local community members. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,400 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Arlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah, 34, is married with four children whose ages are between 2½ and 17 years. Three of the children are currently attending school. She has been in the farming business for 7 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces eggs, sugarcane, vegetables and tea which are all sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 30,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the livelihood of her family. She says that price fluctuations — especially in the tea industry — pests, and diseases and lack of farm inputs like fertilizer have been her major challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim D. (pictured with her grandson) and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Mao, live in suburb of Phnom Penh approximately 25 kilometers away. They have been married since 1985 and have two daughters. One is married and is a garment factory worker, and the other one is in university.  

Sim stays at home and does housework. Her husband is a soldier. The main sources of income are her husband's and daughter’s salaries. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a computer laptop for her daughter who is in university.

loans.use: to purchase a computer laptop for her daughter

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y productos secos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a lugares como yanatile, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y granos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and departament of Cuzco.

The member's name is Rosa. She is 37 years old, single, and has 4 children. she alternates her daily activities with selling vegetables and dry products. She sells as a sreeet vendor, going to different places, such as Yanatile. With this business, she gets her children ahead. Rosa wants to expand her business selling vegetables and dry products. She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables and dry products wholesale.  

She is happy with the loan and committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and dry grains wholesale

loans.name: Perine

texts.en: Perine is 28 years old.  She has 2 children who are  7 and 5 years old, and they are both in school.  Perine owns a general store in which she sells rice, sugar and cooking oil. She has been running this store for 3 years with her husband.  This has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more rice and sugar.  With the profits, she hopes to save as much as possible so that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mamacha Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Calca, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribell; ella es conviviente y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. cafetín, ella tiene el cafetín en el colegio D. la ciudad D. Calca, ella prepara sándwich, refrescos, helados entre otros productos para vender, la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. cafetín. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para el negocio D. cafetín.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. pasteles, venta D. cerveza, servicio D. taxi, negocio D. salón D. belleza y servicio D. mototaxi.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “MAMACHA ASUNTA” communal bank located in Calca District which belongs to Calca Province and Cusco Department.

Maribell, 32, is the member.  She has a spouse and two children.  She runs a snack bar at a school in the city of Calca.  She makes sandwiches, beverages and ice cream, among other products to sell.  She supports her children with this business.  She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook in her snack bar.

The other members bake cakes, sell beer, proviD. taxi services, run beauty salons and proviD. mototaxi services.

She is grateful to those who share her dream through this means and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Adelyn is married and has three school-aged children. Adelyn has a motorized tricycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Adelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Adelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Adelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Adelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel est client d’ACB depuis 2009,il est marié ,il est  il a 33 ans ,il a 1 enfant de 10 mois il a une seul personne en charge ,et il est ne en Uganda mais il est Rwandais.il a niveau d’éducation de 4 ans des études secondaire .c’est son troisième  cycle de  prêt, Emmanuel va utilise le prêt pour acheter une machine de couture ,50 paires tissus d’hommes ,30 paires tissus des femmes. Sa stratégie pour la croissance  de l’affaire est augmentée la capacité du busines, ouverture des autres ateliers. Dans l’avenir il voudrait ouvert des ateliers et avoir un grand atelier de ce district, pour sa famille il voudrait acheter une parcelle et bâtir s propre maison d’habitation.il est aussi éleveur des bovins.
texts.en:
Emmanuel has been an ACB client since 2009. He is 33 years old, married, and has a 10-month child; he has only one dependent. He is born in Uganda, but is Rwandan. He went to school up to the fourth year of high school. This is his third loan, which Emmanuel will use to buy a sewing machine, 50 pieces of fabric for men's clothing and 30 pieces of fabric for women's clothing
His strategy for business growth is to increase capacity and open new workshops. In the future he would like to open workshops and have a large workshop in this district. He would like to purchase a lot for his family and to build his own house. He also raises cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and 50 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom is a hardworking man. He is married and the responsible father of two sons. His wife is a housewife. Islom is engaged in the business of drying and selling of fruits. Islom wishes to improve his living conditions, so he hopes to expand his business and to make a good profit. Islom would like to get a loan of 8,000 TJS for purchasing of fresh apricots to process and sell them at a good price. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fresh apricots to process.

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como ganados, ovejas y chanchos, la socia vende animales en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y para comprar comida para los animales.  
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Elena Emperatriz, a member of “RICHARY ANTEÑA”, a Communal Bank located in Anta, a district of the Anta province, in the Cusco department.

Elena Emperatriz is 70 years old, she is single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity: she sells animals such as livestock, sheep and pigs. She sells them in the different fairs of the Anta province. She wishes to increase and improve her animals sale activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy animals and animal feed.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.en:
Gulnura is 39, single and has two children. She graduated from trade school and has worked as an accountant.

As she is the only bread-winner for her children, in 2007 she started her business selling mobile phones and accessories. Her business became successful, and she expanded it to include mobile phone repairs and photocopying.

Gulnura is requesting a loan of 100,000 KGS, which she will use to broaden her assortment of goods in order to expand her business. It will allow her to save money to purchase a flat for her family.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Zosi

texts.en:
Zosi is a married woman with six children. Five of the children attend school and one has completed school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a grocery business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the delay of delivery of goods in the market. She dreams of expanding her business to establish another grocery in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is thirty years old and single. He has been running his business for the last two years making a monthly profit of 6,000 KES. He has been loaned 30,000 KES and he plans to use the whole amount to purchase waste paper for sale and use.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to advance his education. In the near future he hopes to start a paper industry.

loans.use: to purchase waste paper for sale and use

loans.name: Oklunon We Lingbohoto Che Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des soeurs, et qui mènent des activités complémentaires. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Reine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Reine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Reine est mariée à un électronicien du nom de Florien. Le couple à trois enfants,tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Reine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Reine vend du pétrole et des mèches. Reine s’approvisionne au Nigéria Etat voisin  du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Reine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE is composed of three persons who are sisters who have complementary businesses. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Reine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an electrician by the name of Florien. They have three children, who are all in school and in their care. Reine lives with together with her husband and children. 

To support herself and her children, Reine sells kerosene and hair extensions. She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Reine and the other members of the group OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTO CHE are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy kerosene and hair extensions

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Paulina; tiene 51 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 1 hijo ; la socia trabaja en una entidad pública D. Salud, la socia trabaja más D. 20 años y a incorporado a sus vida un negocio alterno, que le permite crecer económicamente, la socia se encarga D. distribuir zapatos a sus compañeros D. trabajo, la socia hace pedido a su padre y familia que trabaja con ella y piD. en series zapatos para el personal D. trabajo según el área que tienen, la socia también ofrece zapatos para los hijos y parejas D. los trabajadores dejándoles a precios cómodos y en plazos D. dos parte a pagar. La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. otro grupo D. pedidos, la socia dará el pago anticipado a los proveedores para que ella pueda realizar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. zapatos para repartir.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the "COMUZONE ii" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Paulina is 51 years old, married, and has one child.  She has worked for a public health company for more than 20 years.  Paulina has added an alternative business to her life which allows her to grow financially.  She sells shoes to her work colleagues.  Paulina places orders with her father and other family members who work with her and requests shoes for her work colleagues.  She also sells shoes to the children and partners of the people she works with, selling at affordable prices and on credit.  Paulina is a very hard-working woman who needs this loan to invest in buying merchandise.  She will pay her suppliers in order to stock her business.  Paulina is requesting this loan to buy shoes with which to stock her business.

Paulina is grateful for the support that she will receive and therefore pledges to to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 47 años de edad está casado desde hace 29 años con su esposa Martha juntos procrearon 7 hijos aun 4 de ellos de penden de dicha pareja 2 niñas y dos niños, una niña de 13 años, una 6 años, un niño de 10 años y el más pequeño que tiene 4 años es el único que no estudia todavía los otros tres sí. El se dedica a la actividad ganadera ya que desde hace 22 años se dedica a crianza y venta de borregos ahorita tiene 22  borregos en su corra pero piensa vender y si vende se quedara con casi nada así que solicita el crédito para poder comparase 10 borregos mas, no comprara nada de alimento dado que con las ganancias que saque de los borregos que venderá el por su parte de ahí comprara. Por el momento no tiene o no ha tenido ningún tipo de problema ya que solo cuando se enferman pero los lleva al veterinario a así se curan.
Su meta es que sus borregas crezcan para que las ganancias que salgan de ahí sean para solventar los gastos del hogar ya que le gustaría que sus hijos sean grandes profesionistas. “Gracias por el crédito ya que para mí es de gran ayuda y confianza que nos otorgan, voy  hacer crecer grandes mis borregos para no quedar mal con ustedes.”
texts.en:
Jorge, 47, has been married to his wife, Martha, for 29 years.  They have 7 children and four of them still depend on them, two girls and two boys.  A 13-year-old and a 6-year-old girl and a 10-year-old and the youngest, a 4-year-old boy who is the only one not yet in school; the other three are in school.

He has been raising livestock for the last 22 years.  He raises sheep to sell and he currently has 22 lambs in his corral but he plans to sell and if he sells them he’ll be left with practically none so he’s asking for a loan to buy ten more lambs.  He won’t buy any feed because he’ll use money he’ll get from the sale of the other lambs to buy the feed.  For the moment, he hasn’t had nor does he now have any problems because if they get sick he takes them to the veterinarian and they get well that way.

His goal is that his lambs grow so that profits will come from them to cover household expenses since he’d like it if his children became great professionals.  “Thanks for the loan because for me it’s of great help and the trust you place in us.  I am going to see to it that my lambs grow so as not to disappoint you.”

loans.use: to buy ten lambs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with nine grown children. She is 53-years-old and lives in Katipunana, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rosa loves to raise animals. She is engaged in the agricultural business sector raising livestock. While not the only source to generate income, the main source comes from selling cows. She has been feeding and taking care of animals for ten years and was able to have a favorable return in the past few years of trading. Rosa earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from GDMPC to buy calves to raise and sell for a profit in the future. 

Rosa has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rosa hopes to raise them all successfully and be reimbursed. She hopes to have more to raise in the future.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 54 años es casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años, vive con su familia en Cotacachi que se encuentra a 30 minutos de Ibarra en el norte de Ecuador. Segundo se describe como una persona de buenos sentimientos que le gusta ayudar a las personas que mas lo necesiten.

Segundo trabaja con su esposa en la agricultura específicamente en el cultivo de fréjol. Es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, este último va a ser invertido en la compra de abono, fumigantes, palos, alambre y piolas para el sembrío de fréjol, lo cual le va a ayudar a que su producto sea de buena calidad y así podrá obtener buenos ingresos y podrá darle el estudio a su hijo.

Su sueño es comprar más terrenos para poder seguir cultivando y poder dejar de herencia a su hijo para que siga produciendo fréjol.
texts.en:
Segundo is 54, married, and has a 15 year-old son. He lives with his family in Cotacachi, which is located 30 minutes from Ibarra in the northern part of Ecuador. Segundo describes himself as a caring person, who likes to help the people who need it most. Segundo works with his wife in farming; specifically in growing beans. 

He is applying for his third loan from Fodemi. He will use this latest loan to buy fertilizers, crop sprays, poles, wires and twine for growing beans. This will help him ensure that his crop is of good quality, and this way he will be able to get good income and be able to pay for his son's education. 

His dream is to buy more land in order to continue farming, and to leave it to his son as a legacy, so that he keeps growing beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, crop sprays, poles, wire, and twine for growing beans.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 57 years old and married with a child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rene has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Rene has been in this business for 15 years.

Rene requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Rene would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Jose Adrian tiene 46 años, es un hombre trabajador, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, por lo que sabe las experiencias que ha atravesado. Lleva 18 años con su actividad que es una pulpería y venta de pescado, sabe que tiene que esforzarse y dedicarle tiempo a su negocio, no hay nada difícil, su único  fin es solventar los gastos económicos de su hogar. Con el tiempo desea mejorar. Este será su crédito número 3 con el que comprara granos básicos, jugos, sopas, enlatados, cigarrillos, fósforos y papel higiénico. Con el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar lo necesario para su actividad.
texts.en:
Jose Adrian is 46 years old and a hardworking gentleman.  This is not the first time he has requested loans, so he is familiar with the process.  He has been in business for 18 years, both managing a store and selling fish.  Adrian knows that he must strive and devote time to his business, so he has not had any difficulties.  His only wish is to cover his household expenses.  He wants to improve over time.

This will be his third loan and he will use the money to buy basic grains, juices, soups, canned goods, cigarettes, matches, and toilet paper.  The loan he requested will enable him to buy whatever he needs for his business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, juices, soups, canned goods, cigarettes, matches, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi is a 77-year-old enterprising businessman. He is married and blessed with seven adult children. He has been running a butchery for the past five months with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Maingi will use the loan to buy bull for slaughtering to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand the business. His hope is to be the main meat distributor around his area, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughtering to add to his business

loans.name: Amua Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amua Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of the Amua group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family, access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure good produce on his farm. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amua group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Matilde De Jesus

texts.es: Matilde, es un joven de 24 años, soltero, nacido en la comarca el Coyolito  ubicada en la Concordia municipio de Jinotega, el se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas. Esta actividad la trae por herencia de sus padres ya que sus hermanos mayores al igual que resto de  su familia se dedican a la agricultura, siembran repollo, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla y también se dedican a la crianza de ganado y venta de leche.  El hizo su primera siembra a los 16 años de edad fue de tomates. Ahora  que se independizo de su padre quiere sembrar repollo. Es por ello que realizo el préstamo para compra de insumos, fertilizantes para llevar a termino el cultivo de repollo. Una de sus metas próximas es comprar ganado lechero en la medida de lo posible y continuar con el negocio de las hortalizas para hacer prosperar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Matilde, 24 years old and single, was born in Coyolito county in La Concordia, a municipality of Jinotega.  He cultivates vegetables for a living since he inherited the activity from his parents.  His older siblings and the rest of the family are also involved in agriculture and grow cabbage, tomatoes, sweet pepper, and onions.  They also raise cattle and sell milk.  He planted his first crop of tomatoes when he was 16 years old.  Now that he is independent from his father he wants to grow cabbage.  In order to do this he has requested a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his cabbage crop.  One of his future goals is to buy dairy cattle and continue with his vegetable activity so he can get ahead and grow his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for his cabbage crop.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 43-year-old, married woman.  She lives with her husband and three children. Two of the children are still attending school and the other is working. She started selling clothes from her home in 1995.  She’s now working with her husband to earn higher revenues and cover their children’s educational fees. Her husband has owned a coffee shop for the past 16 years. Today, she wants to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional quantities of clothes, such as coats, scarves and pants. She notes that this Kiva loan will improve her business and thus allow her to gain more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: purchase clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Emily Makokha

texts.en: Emily is 46-years-old, married and has five children ranging from six to twenty years. She describes herself as an idealistic woman. She runs a grocery store where she has sold cabbages, onions, tomatoes, carrots, oranges and mangoes for the last four years. Her business worry is the high cost of goods sold when buying them. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy tomatoes, onions and mangoes. Emily hopes in the future to have had expanded her grocery store into wholesale and venture into providing services on rental houses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and mangoes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 39 years old, married, has five children and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by planting and harvesting coconuts. She earns about PHP 4,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,850 to buy seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In 2007, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her life. Rosa's goal for the future is to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a coconut farm.

loans.name: Puro Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la Oriflame desde hace dos años ese es el caso de Francisca, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de oriflame, es una mujer casada, con tres hijos que le ayudan a colocar el producto ya que los vende al crédito, Emilce vende cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat y María de los Angeles hace repostería como queque, vende gaseosa en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three enterprising members.  Francisca has sold Oriflame brand cosmetics for the last two years.  She will use the loan to buy Oriflame cosmetics.  She’s married with three children who help her sell her products since she sells on credit.

Emilce sells Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics, María de los Ángeles makes pastries like cakes and sells soft-drinks at home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Atchadé Gabriel

texts.fr: Atchadé Gabriel est âgé de 48 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Elisabeth. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Atchadé Gabriel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison.  Atchadé Gabriel a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Atchadé Gabriel  est un meunier, activité qu’il exerce depuis vingt cinq ans dans sa région. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Atchadé Gabriel achète également des noix de palme qu’il transforme. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Atchadé Gabriel  sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Atchadé Gabriel s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Atchadé Gabriel is 48 years old and is married to a merchant named Elisabeth. The couple has five children, of whom some have been to school. None of the children are under their care. Atchadé Gabriel lives with this wife and children. Together the couple takes care of the household expenses. Atchadé Gabriel has attended primary school.

Atchadé Gabriel is a miller, a job he has done for 25 years in his region. This has allowed him to support the needs of his family. He also buys palm nuts which he makes [into oil]. He procures his goods from a town in Benin.

In order to satisfy his customers, Atchadé Gabriel is seeking his fifth loan with Alidé. His previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy a corn mill and a palm nut presser

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
Jeni (25) is a young mother of 2 kids who are under 5 years old. Jeni is married to Doddy, who works as motorcycle taxi driver or called ojek. Her daily activities including sells crops at local market. There are few things that she sells but main product to bring significant income is red onion.  

As the rain season is coming now, the price of red onion in the market is increases quite faster, this is an opportunity where Jeni could improve her income but Jeni couldn't do that due to limitation of business capital. She then was introduced to Group loan product that TLM offers, and joined with an existing group. Jeni has received IDR. 2.250.000 and has spend mostly to buy 2 more sacs of red onion while partly spend on other crops.

loans.use: to buy more 2 sacks of onion and other crops

loans.name: Katty

texts.en:
Katty has been making soy milk for four years. She learned this skill when she worked for a state-run day care center for children. One year ago she left and began to manufacture soy milk on her own. Currently she produces it in her own kitchen at home and she has a seller who places it. From Monday through Fiday she works on production beginning at 4:00 am, and at 7:00 she goes out to sell. This business has permitted her to have income and to buy her simple house made of cane.

She needs this loan to be able to buy a mill for grinding soybeans, and to buy a freezer with which she will be able to produce more soy milk and place it herself, since she already has clients.

Katty is 37 years old, she has 2 children in school and is a single mother. Since the beginning, she has been in charge of her children, she has her own house, bought through great sacrifice and hard work, and currently she is above water. Her aspiration is that her children study and aren't left without a profession, so she wants to strengthen the business since it is her only source of income. Katty is a very hardworking and responsible woman who struggles each day to improve her quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Katty tiene 4 años en esta actividad, aprendió cuando trabajaba para una de las guarderías de niños del estado, salio hace un año y se puso a elaborar por su cuenta la leche de soya, actualmente ella las produce y tiene un vendedor que las coloca, en su propia cocina de su casa a acondicionado sus equipos, de lunes a viernes se dedica a producir, el movimiento de la producción es a partir de las 4:00 AM, a las 7:00 AM sale a vender. El negocio le ha permite tener ingresos y poder comprar su casa de caña.

Ella necesita el préstamo para poder comprar un molino para moler el grano de soya, y comprar una hielera, con esto ella puede producir más y colocar ya que sí tiene cliente.

Katty tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos en la escuela, es madre soltera, desde el comienzo se a hecho cargo de sus hijos, tiene casa propia actualmente esta sobre el agua, es lo que ha podido comprar con mucho sacrificio del trabajo, su aspiración es que sus hijos estudien y no se queden sin profesión, fortalecer el negocio porque es su única fuente de ingresos, Katty es una mujer trabajadora y responsable lucha cada día por mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy a mill and freezer

loans.name: Jensiama

texts.en: Ohenewa is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has benefited from its products for several years. She wants to expand her business. She sells Ghanaian Kentey cloth. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on his onion business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en: Petrona is 26 years old, single, and living with her parents. Her five brothers and sisters live in Santo Domingo, because they go to the university there. Her parents are farmers. Petrona sells clothes and shoes in her parents’ house. She started that business one year ago after being obliged to drop out of school for financial reasons. Her parents couldn’t provide the transport for her, since she had to spend more than $40 a week to go to school in the city. Currently she is back in school, since she earns sufficient money from her business. The entrepreneur needs a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes, because she has these in short supply. She is working hard to grow her business so as to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothes and shoes for her business, since these are in short supply

loans.name: Namig

texts.en: M. Namig is a 42-year-old married father of two children. He is a farmer from Fizuli region and he lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in eastern Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1993, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved. In 2005, Namig borrowed $500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled. He is requesting a loan of  $1,000 to purchase three small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 12 months. This will help him improve his stock and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase three small bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a married woman with 4 kids, living in the village of Saaga Siumu. Her business is a Taro plantation run by her husband. She sells 2-3 bags of taro once a week at Fugalei market, and she gets $80-100 USD. Before joining the program, her family depends only on remittances from overseas. But when she joined SPBD in 2004, she experienced a big change. She can now pay her kids' school fees and a lot family purposes.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
K. Rahmatullo is 39 years old. He is married with three children and his wife is a housekeeper.

Rahmatullo has been working with IMON for more than three years and has a positive credit history. For more than 12 years he has been running a small open café where he cooks kebabs. His café is located inside the food market of the city. Rahmatullo's children are growing up fast -- his the elder daughter is 16 years old and will enter university this year, while his younger daughter and son are 14 and 12 correspondingly. Rahmatullo needs to prepare a dowry for his elder daughter but unfortunately does not earn enough income for this.

Rahmatullo is requesting a loan of 3000.00 Somoni (US$875) to increase his capital and expand his business, promising to repay the loan in 3 months. Rahmatullo hopes that by being able to generate a good income, he will help his daughter to enter university and will also have the funds for to pay his daughter's dowry and arrange his elder daughter's wedding.

loans.use: To enlarge his working capital and to use the income generated to pay for his daughter's university education and her wedding.

loans.name: Firdos' Group

texts.en: My name is Firdos A.. I am married and have eight children, six boys and two girls. I live with my family in Multan, a mid-sized city in Southern Punjab, a province of Pakistan. One of my sons runs a TV cable agency and we need a loan to expand his business. I am borrowing in a group that includes three other women: Zarina I. runs a boutique. Laiqa N. is borrowing to expand her husband’s auto workshop. Arjaman B. also operates a boutique. These women are poor and need loans to expand their companies. Please help us secure the required amount of our loan and grow our businesses.

loans.use: Expand a TV cable agency and three other small businesses

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en: Zebi N. lives in the Spitamen region, and she is married with three children. She sells her homegrown potatoes wholesale in the collective farm bazaar. Now Mrs. N. is applying for a loan of 2,500 STJ for the seasonal preparation.

loans.use: The seasonal preparation

loans.name: Hubaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Hubaldo S. rents a home on Luís Espinal street in the Chuquiaguillo zone of the city of La Paz. He is legally separated from his wife and owns a car that he uses as a public taxi, generating income this way.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase tires and repair his vehicle because without these things, he cannot work, this being his only source of income. He would like to leave his car in excellent condition so that he can go back to work as usual.

He has good credit history and qualifies for a new loan. He has been a member of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hubaldo vive en alquiler en la calle Luís Espinal de la zona de Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz; está separado de la esposa, tiene un auto el cual hace trabajar como taxi de servicio publico generando así sus ingresos de subsistencia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas y reparar su movilidad ya que con las fallas que tiene no puede trabajar y es su único medio de ingresos. Lo que quiere es poner su taxi en buenas condiciones y trabajar con normalidad.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase tires for taxi

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Sr. Rene is someone with a great desire to succeed despite his physical disability (he has problems with his lower limbs). He acts responsibly in whatever he does, always fulfils his obligations, and pays off his loans. In spite of his disability, he wants to get on in life so that he can feel useful. Currently he lives in the modest home that belonged to his parents before they died some time ago. He shares the house with his nephews and nieces whom he helps with their studies so that they can have the opportunities that were not available to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rene es una persona con muchos deseos de superación pese a su discapacidad física, ( problemas en las extremidades inferiores) el desarrolla sus actividades con bastante responsabilidad y es muy cumplido con sus obligaciones y en el pago de sus créditos, pese a su discapacidad el quiere seguir adelante para sentirse útil en la vida, el vive actualmente en la casa muy humilde de sus padres quienes fallecieron tiempo atrás, la cual comparte con sus sobrinos a los cuales el les ayuda en sus estudios para que así tengan las posibilidades que el no pudo tener.

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale for re-sale in a small, well-established shop

loans.name: Samuel Trust Group

texts.en: Esther S. is a divorced wife with five children. She is a 54-year-old trader of used bed spreads. She is the leader of a seven-member group with six females and a single male. These are the breadwinners of their families. They all have children who are currently in school. They are engaged in the trading of food stuffs, clothing, cosmetics, groceries, etc. as the source of livelihood for their homes. However, they barely make enough income to meet the demands of their households due to inadequate working capital. Their common dream is to see their businesses grow one day to enable them to improve the living conditions of their families. They believe this loan will help them to inject more capital into their businesses to materialize this dream. They belong to the group called Samuel Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee for one another as a social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of food stuffs, groceries, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Las Rosas Semetabaj Group

texts.en:
The villagers from San Andres Semetabaj breathe the peaceful environment of this small lovely town. Most of the villagers know each other very well which creates an environment of trust. Walking down the clean streets of San Andres one can see many people chatting and children playing. This is a typical village where people help each other out with their daily tasks. 
Fortunately, this cultural factor is also reflected in Las Rosas´ organization. Some members of the group are better doing the paperwork and arrange the meetings, whereas others have more acquaintances that can help the younger ones of the group to sell their products to a bigger group of customers.
This is how Doña Manuela C., who is one of oldest of the group, helps the younger members. She has a store in one of the main streets at which she sells traditional blouses. Doña Manuela is very well known in the village because of her store. When a customer asks her about clothes she doesn't sell in her store, she refers them to group members like Ami. Ami is one of the younger members of the group. She also sells blouses, but from a different type, they are called croshet blouses, they have a very different look from the traditional ones.
Alma G. is the president of the group. She has a sister in another group who enthusiastically told her about Friendship Bridge. Alma, formed a group with her friends and neighbours who, like her, mostly work in buying and selling clothes. 
They all want to invest their credit in purchasing a more diverse repertoire of clothes. The other four women, who own a food store, also want to expand the diversity of products in order to capture more clients and increase their sales. 
Las Rosas want to keep working hard in order to keep building their new improved life. They wish to have a solid business so they don't have to leave their families behind in order to go and sell their goods at far away markets. That's why they try to communicate well to one another about their business ideas so they are not over-supply San Andres with the same goods, says Catalina. 
 Las Rosas are doing a great job a working together and accomplishing unity within their trust bank, with your support they will keep working in this manner and accomplishing their dreams. Thanks!

loans.use: Invest in the store itself and a bigger range of products

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja es una joven madre de 26 años de edad, la actividad que aprendió de sus padres le permite cubrir las necesidades  básicas  de su hogar,  sobre todo  la de su pequeña y querida niña Nayel de un añito, su trabajo como artesana textil se convirtió en el sustento principal de su hogar, ya que su esposo tiene trabajos  eventuales  y poco remunerados.Con el dinero que solicita, esta talentosa madre tiene pensado comprar variedad de lana para seguir confeccionando sus pantalones, chullos y  diferentes prendas, que serán vendidas al por mayor en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca.
texts.en:
Maruja is a young mother, 26 years old. The trade that she learned from her parents has allowed her to cover the basic needs of her household, especially the needs of her dear, little girl, Nayel who is one year old. Her work as a textile artisan became the main means of support of her home. Her husband has occasional jobs who are poorly compensated. With the loan that she is applying for, this talented mother will buy a variety of wool to continue making pants, sweaters, and different clothing pieces that will be sold at wholesale at the San Jose market in the city of Juliaca


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of wool and other materials to continue making her pieces.

loans.name: Haidarali

texts.ru: Азизов Хайдарали житель Джиликульского района. Возраст 24 года. Имеет двоих детей. Обеспечивает семью путем торговли. Торгует на центральном рынке.Привозит товар из города Душанбе, который покупает у оптовых реализаторов. Привозит товар к себе и продает в розницу. Его бизнес приносит доход ему лично, а так же население , покупая  у него товар выигрывает в том , что им не приходится ехать за покупками в город Душанбе и тратить деньги на дорогу. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Haidarali A. lives in the Jillikuli region. He is 24 years old and has two children. Haidarali provides for his family by selling goods at the central market. He purchases clothes from wholesalers in Dushanbe and brings them to his region where they can be sold for a profit. Haidarali's business is beneficial not only to him but to other people in the region who don't need to spend money traveling to Dushanbe in order to buy clothes. Haidarali would like to take out this loan in order to buy more seasonal goods wholesale. He will be able to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods wholesale

loans.name: Ticana Gaspar

texts.pt:
Ticana nasceu em Manhiça, tem 41 anos de idade estudou ata a 8ª classe vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 29 aos 22 anos, 3 dos seus filhos estão na universidade e os restantes estão empregados.
 Ticana após de concluir a 8ª classe  teve que interroper os estudos  devido a má condiçao financeira dos pais. Sai de Manhiça para Marracuene  com o seu esposo em emisão de serviço este que era Director da agricultura daquele Distrito e governou durante 5 anos. Ticana porque tinha um bom nivel de escolaridade o administrador convida-lhe para trabalhar como secretaria particular dele dois anos depois  o seu esposo é  transferido para  trabalhar em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia e assim abandona o seu emprego.. Chegado a Namaacha ticana pede emprestado um valor a sua  irma mais velha e começa a praticar negócio de criaçao de pintos  com ajuda do seu esposo que é tecnico agrónomo uma actividade que exerce ate hoje. Além de ser uma  grande criadora de frangos é dona de uma barraca de refeiçoes, mas porque os pintos precisam de muita atençao ela não tem horario fixo de trabalho, tem criado no maximo 5x100 caixas de pintos a 35.000.00mt e revende cada a 85.00mt  cria em fases para poder   vender alternadamente. Tem como melhor produto o frango já preparado que vende em sua barraca tem tido um lucro de 4.000.00mt mensalmente consegue poupar por mês 500.00mt porque tem que pagar dispesas dos seus filhos que se encontram a estudar na universidade, uma vez que o seu marido teve problrmas no seviço e perdeu o emprego.
Este é o segundo empréstimo de Ticana  na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00mt usou para comprar pintos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhuma dificuldade e pede este segundo de 12.000.00mt para reforcar o seu negocio . Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro emprestimo para a construcao do murro da sua residencia.
texts.en:
Ticana was born in Manhiça. She is 41 years old and attended school until the 8th grade. She is married and the mother of 5 children between the ages of 22 and 29. Three of her children are in college, and the others are working. After finishing the 8th grade Ticana had to interrupt her studies due to the poor financial conditions of her parents. She left Manhiça for Marracuene with her husband who served as the Director of Agriculture in that district for 5 years. Because she had a good level of schooling, Ticana was invited by the administrator to work as his secretary. Two years later her husband was transferred to work in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, so she abandoned her job. Having arrived in Namaacha Ticana got a loan from her oldest sister and began her business of raising chickens with the help of her husband who is an expert agronomist; an activity that they continue today. Besides being a great chicken farmer she is also owner of a food shack, but because the chicks require a lot of attention she does not have fixed hours of work. She makes at a maximum 5X100 boxes of chickens at 35MT and resells each one for 85MT. She raises them in phases to be able to sell alternatingly. Her best product is a ready-prepared chicken that she sells from her stand. She makes 4,000MT per month but is only able to save 500MT because she has to pay expenses for her children who are studying at the university, and her husband had problems in the service and lost his job. This is Ticana's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan of 15,000MT was used to purchase chickens and she was able to repay without any difficulties. She is requesting this second loan of 12,000MT to reinforce her business. She is confidant that she can pay off the loan before maturity so she can ask for another loan to construct a wall around her residence.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising chickens

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es comerciante de revistas para colorear y pequeños libros para niños de 3 a 7 años de edad; tiene su puesto en la Ceja de El Alto.
